content: Sunmarke Premium British Education | Best International School Mission, Vision, Values About > Mission, Vision, Values Mission, Vision, Values Inspiring Students to Thrive and Grow Every Day Our Vision ‘Empowering young people through an innovative and character-building education that inspires them to thrive and achieve with purpose.’ Our Mission ‘Nurturing the next generation of changemakers for a better tomorrow.’ Our Values We ASPIRE to uphold the following values: Accountability We believe in taking responsibility and leading by example Service We believe in helping colleagues, giving back to our community and serving society Purpose We believe in living a life of greater purpose and in making a positive impact on society Integrity We believe in upholding the highest standards of ethical conduct in thought, word and deed Respect We recognise our differences as well as our commonalities and believe in treating one another with courtesy and respect Excellence We strive to be the best we can be and in giving our 100% British Values As a British Schools Overseas (BSO) accredited school, Sunmarke School is committed to upholding the values and standards of a world-class British education. This includes a strong focus on the spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of our students, as well as the promotion of respect, tolerance, and responsibility. These principles align seamlessly with the values of the UAE, where respect for diversity and cultural understanding form the foundation of daily life. Together, these shared values shape our school community into one that is inclusive, aspirational, and globally minded. Rule of Law – School policies, codes of conduct, and classroom expectations help pupils understand fairness, responsibility, and the importance of living within agreed rules, reflecting the laws of the UAE. Individual Liberty – We encourage independence and student choice in learning, while ensuring safety and guidance so pupils understand the balance between rights and responsibilities. Mutual Respect – Our Positive Education ethos, house system, and community partnerships promote kindness and respect in daily interactions across the school. Tolerance of Different Faiths and Beliefs – We celebrate the UAE’s cultural and religious diversity, providing opportunities to learn about and respect different traditions while remaining rooted in our own values. Student Voice & Representation – Pupils are given a voice through Student Council, Sports Leaders, and other leadership opportunities, ensuring they understand the importance of fairness, collaboration, and shared decision-making. Why Educate Your Child at Sunmarke? A Rigorous & Ambitious Education We offer rigorous, ambitious and holistic education emphasising academic excellence and participation in diverse extracurricular activities enabling children to achieve outstanding academic, social and personal success in a stimulating and supportive environment. Outstanding Senior Leaders & Teachers All our inspiring senior leaders, teachers and staff are trained in Positive Education and best practices in education, and are provided continuous professional development and training to keep abreast of the latest developments in pedagogy. Over Four Decades of History Built on the foundation of Fortes Education’s four decades of excellence in education, Sunmarke’s dynamic management team bring their rich experience and knowledge to deliver the best value-based education for students.

Principal's Message | Sunmarke School Principal’s Message About > Principal’s Message Principal’s Message Mr. Nicholas Rickford Welcome to Sunmarke School – Where Amazing Happens It is with great pleasure that I welcome you to Sunmarke School, a place where tailored academic pathways, innovative Signature Programmes and a holistic approach to Positive Education converge to provide an outstanding educational experience for your child. At Sunmarke, we understand that every student is unique, with their own strengths, interests and aspirations. That is why we have developed a wide range of academic pathways that allow us to cater to the individual needs of every student. We are one of the very few schools to offer students the choice of A Level, IB Diploma, IB Career-related Programme and BTEC. By providing such enviable options and personalising learning experiences, we empower students to explore their passions and reach their full potential in a supportive and dynamic environment. One of our key areas of focus is Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics. Our STEAM and Design Thinking curriculum fosters creativity, critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Through hands-on projects, collaborative learning and exposure to real-world applications, Sunmarke students engage with virtual reality, learn how to code and develop the essential skills of tech literacy and digital fluency. As we prepare students for the future, we recognise the vital role that artificial intelligence (AI) plays in our society. We embrace AI, incorporating it into our curriculum and enabling learners to consider the limitless possibilities and ethical considerations associated with this transformative technology. Through our innovative AI programmes, students gain practical experience, develop computational thinking skills and become equipped to navigate the AI-driven world of tomorrow. Our other Signature Programmes provide further opportunities for Sunmarke students to explore their interests and talents in specialised areas. From Performing Arts, Media and Communication to the Global Language Academy and Environment and Sustainability (which includes the incredible Forest School), our signature offerings inspire students to delve deep into their passions, develop expertise and build a strong sense of compassion and social responsibility. At Sunmarke, we are extremely proud to offer a world-class, comprehensive Positive Education programme. We believe that academic success is intricately linked to emotional wellbeing, character development and the cultivation of positive relationships. Our PosEd framework fosters resilience, empathy and a growth mindset. Through mindfulness practices, character education and social-emotional learning, we enable all our students to thrive academically, emotionally and socially. I invite you to explore our website to learn more about our academic strengths, unrivalled Signature Programmes and Positive Education approach. We look forward to partnering with you in nurturing your child’s intellectual curiosity, fostering their passions and equipping them for the future. In joining Sunmarke, your family will become part of a forward-thinking, vibrant and welcoming community “Where Amazing Happens”. Warm regards, Nicholas Rickford Principal

Sunmarke | Positive Education International School in Dubai A Positive Education School About > A Positive Education School A Positive Education School A Philosophy Where Character Strengths Underpin Academic Excellence Truly outstanding education is not just about academic and personal achievements but also about the development of character, values, and wellbeing. This is the essence of Positive Education (PosEd). A scientifically-proven concept, PosEd is causing a paradigm shift in global education where parents, schools and governments realise the need to increase a child’s ‘wellbeing’ to raise his/her levels of ‘achievement’. PosEd brings together the science of Positive Psychology combined with the best teaching practices to enable individuals, schools, and communities to flourish, be resilient, creative, successful and happy. Sunmarke – A Character-Building School Multiple studies on the effects of PosEd testify that improved levels of a child’s wellbeing are associated with higher levels of academic engagement, social skills, optimism, behaviour, and fewer mental health-related issues. Positive Education – Sunmarke’s DNA Positive Education (PosEd) is not an additional subject at Sunmarke but it’s woven into the fabric of the international school’s culture and is reflected in all its activities and teaching mechanisms. Sunmarke’s teachers undergo an intense training programme before entering the classroom where they learn, live, teach and embed Positive Education. This is what our teachers say about the Positive Education training they receive at Sunmarke: “Where amazing happens. A motto that at first glance just appears to be some words to attract parents to send their children to Sunmarke school, almost like a gimmick. Over the past 3 days for me amazing did happen. The positive education training took me on a journey of self-discovery, showing me that changing my mindset can bring positive outcomes. I realized I have the power to make a difference in people’s lives. This training was the best I’ve ever received from a school, as they genuinely cared about us, ensuring we could apply what we learned in teaching and at home. It was an incredible experience, especially since I used to dislike training due to its lack of usefulness. This was entirely different – truly helpful, purposeful, and enlightening. It taught me to believe in the potential of education to inspire change.” “The breadth of knowledge, evidence-based theories, outstanding coordination and delivery, and just everything about this week was outstanding! I was blown away in every way possible and feel so supported, valued, and appreciated.” The ‘Flourish’ Model The 6 Key Skills Practised and Taught by Sunmarke Teachers for Students to Incorporate in Their Lives SUNMARKE'S WELLBEING & COUNSELLING TEAM Our PosEd and wellbeing approach fosters deep trust in our school community, creating a safe, welcoming and nurturing environment. We embed various initiatives into the daily routines, curriculum and extracurricular activities to establish a personal, social and academic support system each child needs to flourish. Class and Form Tutors, Heads of Year, and Subject teachers support students every day through direct teaching, mentoring, workshops and assemblies. The Counselling Department provides compassionate care for children who may require professional support and or simply a sympathetic listening ear. Students and parents both have access to a School Counsellor. A ‘Wellbeing Champion’ represents the school leadership in our Parent Association and ‘Friends of Sunmarke School’ (FOSS) group while the popular monthly ‘Wellness Wednesday’ event raises awareness among parents about crucial topics like strength-based parenting, raising children in the digital age and health and nutrition. SUNMARKE'S SAFEGUARDING & CHILD PROTECTION TEAM Sunmarke has a designated Safeguarding and Child Protection Team with Child Protection Officers at every Key Stage in primary and secondary school. Click here for more information on our Safeguarding & Child Protection Team Safeguarding & Child Protection Policy We are also a certified school with the National Online Safety programme benchmarked to the best school safety standards in the UK. Please find more information about NOS here: https://nationalonlinesafety.com/

Sunmarke Leadership Team | British Curriculum School in Dubai Leadership About > Leadership Leadership At the heart of leadership is a desire to serve and a dedication to helping others become great. Sunmarke’s biggest strength is its passionate senior leadership team and faculty of teachers whose world-class experience in teaching, learning and administration has led the institution to be rated as one of the best schools in Dubai. Our educators are commited to building character, wellbeing and values in a child, along with ensuring academic excellence with a strong belief in Sunmarke’s disruptively innovative approach to education. The school is guided by a Board of Governors comprising teachers, senior leaders, and a Parents’ Body who bring their rich professional experience, insight and advice to building one of the foremost British curriculum schools in Dubai. Sunmarke is further nurtured by a Board of Directors with over four decades of experience in school management. The Board supports the school’s growth by onboarding world-class senior leaders and teachers, and investing in up-to-date educational practices and facilities. Our educators hail from top-ranked universities in the UK. The Director of Fortes Education, Dr Neil Hopkin, the ex-principal at Sunmarke school is a globally renowned Principal and thought leader in education. Our senior leaders are nationally recognised education practitioners in the UK and our teachers have been associated with leading schools in the UK and elsewhere in the world. Senior Leadership Team Divisional Heads & Managing Directors Of Schools Board of Directors Mr Nicholas Rickford Principal Mrs Linzi Hammond Head of EYFS Ms Andrea Higgins Head of Primary Mr Tariq Bell Head of Secondary Mrs Tracey Bishop Head of Educational Operations Mrs Assile Al-Amili Deputy Head & Strategic Advisor Ms Jayne West Deputy Headteacher - Inclusion Ms Fiona McConnon Deputy Headteacher & Head of Global Language Mrs Faye Wright Assistant Headteacher - EYFS Mrs Sadia Chaudry Fareed Assistant Headteacher - EYFS Ms Annie Griffth Deputy Headteacher - Primary Mr Henry Craig Assistant Headteacher - Primary Ms Gemma Munro Assistant Headteacher - Primary Ms Claire Young Deputy Headteacher - Secondary Ms Becky Holden Assistant Headteacher - Pastoral - Secondary Ms Jehan Toubia Assistant Headteacher - Secondary & Head of Sixth Form Mr Richard Bishop Assistant Headteacher - Secondary Mrs Jodie Lambourn Assistant Headteacher - Secondary Mrs Shakuntala Mankani Founder, Fortes Education Mrs Veena Vaswani Co-Founder Mr Sanjay Mankani Chairman & Managing Director Fortes Education Mr Ajay Mankani Vice Chair & Executive Director Fortes Education Dr Neil Hopkin, FRSA Director of Education of Fortes Education Mrs Katrina Mankani Divisional Head & Managing Director Sunmarke School; Director of Positive Education & Innovation of Fortes Education; & Managing Director Jumeirah International Nurseries Mrs Devika Mankani Divisional Head & Managing Director Regent International School & Chief Positive Psychologist of Fortes Education ">

Outstanding Academic Result | British Curriculum School in Dubai Academic Results About > Academic Results Academic Results Outstanding exam results One of the few international schools in Dubai to offer both IB, A-Levels curriculum pathways and BTECs, Sunmarke consistently achieves ‘Outstanding’ exam results year on year, a fact reflected in our scores at all levels as well as global university placements. Sunmarke is consistently recogonised among the best schools in Dubai thanks to its academic excellence. Our IBDP Results Our Excellent IBDP results for the academic year 2024 – 25: 36.5 IBDP AVERAGE POINTS SCORE more than 6 points above the world average 90% students exceeding the world average 66% students exceeding 35+ points 28% more than one in four students achieved 40+ points Our A-Level & BTEC Results Our A-Level students go on to pursue courses at the top universities around the world. With a choice of 23 different subjects, Sunmarke’s Sixth Formers excel by choosing subjects that they are most passionate about with ample support from our teachers. Outstanding A-Level & BTEC results for the academic year 2024 – 25: 100% student pass rate at A-Level & BTEC 97% A-LEVEL A*- C BTEC D*-M 78% A-LEVEL A*- B BTEC D*-D 53% A-LEVEL A*- A BTEC D* Our GCSE Results Our GSCE students experience a diverse and enriched curriculum that enables them to find success in their chosen careers. These results reflect the extraordinary accomplishments of each of our 25 GCSE subjects. Outstanding GCSE results in the academic year 2024-25: 100% student pass rate at GCSE 95% GCSE 9-4 (A*- C) including English & Maths 74% GCSE 9-6 (A*- B) 55% GCSE 9-7 (A*- A) Click to read Sunmarke Schools results mentioned on Which School Advisor , Edarabia .

Sunmarke Outstanding School | KHDA Inpection Report Inspection Reports About > Inspection Reports Inspection Reports Rated "OUTSTANDING" & "Very Good" - Recognition By BSO and KHDA British Schools Overseas Inspection Report 2023 – Rated “OUTSTANDING” Sunmarke was rated ‘ Outstanding ’ by the British Schools Overseas (BSO) inspection report of 2023. The BSO is an inspection agency that follows the framework and standards of the Department of Education (DfE) in the UK for National Curriculum schools. Click here to view our inspection report. KHDA Inspection Report 2023-24 – Rated “Very Good” Sunmarke achieved “ Outstanding ” and “ Very Good ” ratings in the Knowledge and Human Development Agency (KHDA) and Dubai School Inspection Bureau (DSIB) Report (2023-2024) and received an overall “ Very Good ”. Click here to download the full report. 5 OUTSTANDING features the inspectors found in EVERY phase of Sunmarke School: Health and safety, including arrangements for child protection and safeguarding Care and support Students’ personal development Social responsibility and innovation skills Understanding of Islamic values and awareness of Emirati and world cultures 10 AMAZING things the inspectors say about Sunmarke School: We are highly inclusive. We have a clear vision for ensuring the wellbeing of everyone, which is founded on Positive Education. We use rigorous policies, systems, and practices that ensure students’ safety. We demonstrate mutual respect and open communication that contribute to a thriving leadership culture. We have premises which are of excellent quality and are meticulously maintained. We have outstanding resources to support teaching and learning. We use assessment well in lesson planning and gauge understanding through probing questioning. Sunmarke students demonstrate a strong sense of responsibility and independence; they interact with maturity and confidence. Sunmarke students are enthusiastic learners who have a well-developed sense of conservation and sustainability. Sunmarke parents actively contribute to the school and FOSS ensures community cohesion.

Sunmarke School Achievements | British Curriculum School in Dubai Our Achievements About > Our Achievements Student Achievements Making A Mark In Academics and Beyond Sunmarke students are encouraged to explore their potential and individuality to the maximum as they participate in activities which allow their talent to shine. Be it academics, sports or creative arts, our children excel in competitions with primary and secondary schools in the region. The World’s Best Debater Title Sunmarke student, Carlota Figueroa Ortiz, won the World’s Best Individual Debate title competing against 4,100 scholars from around the world. It was an astounding achievement for our talented scholar who displayed all qualities of a future leader. The Nikon Choice Award Winner Sixth Form student Ayusha Roy, received the Nikon Choice Award in the ‘Legacy of Zayed’ Photography Competition 2018 for her work celebrating the timeless legacy of H.H. Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan and the impact he had on the UAE and its values. ‘Outstanding Pearson Learner Award’ awarded to Sunmarke stars Sixth Formers, Abigail and Moiz received A* grades in Geography, Science and Statistics. Edexcel Pearson announced these students’ qualification for the ‘Outstanding Pearson Learner Award 2017’ in their subjects awarding them with the highest marks in the Middle East. School Awards & Recognitions Honours And Accolades For An Outstanding Institution Sunmarke School carries forward the legacy of excellence in education, established by Fortes Education. It is an honour and privilege for us to be recognised by distinguished platforms as we continue our incredible journey as one of the best international schools in Dubai. Each of these awards is a testament to the quality and dedication of our staff and students. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Schools Compared Sunmarke School has achieved remarkable recognition and distinction as a finalist in multiple prestigious categories at the Schools Compared Top School Awards. We take immense pride in being acknowledged as the ‘Most Innovative School in the United Arab Emirates’, the ‘Best Blended International Baccalaureate Curriculum School in the UAE 2023-24’, and the esteemed ‘Best Primary School Teacher of the Year 2023-24’. Furthermore, Sunmarke School’s exceptional performance has led to our selection as a shortlisted contender in various categories for the year 2023-24. These include the titles of ‘Best Blended International Baccalaureate School in the United Arab Emirates’, ‘Best British School in the United Arab Emirates’, ‘Best School for Post-16 Education in the United Arab Emirates’, ‘Best School for Technical Stream Vocational Education in the United Arab Emirates’, and ‘Most Innovative School in the United Arab Emirates’. Notably, Sunmarke School’s accomplishments extend beyond recent years. We have previously been recognised as a finalist for the ‘Best New School Award’ 2018-19, the esteemed ‘Post 16 Award’ 2018-19, and the prestigious ‘Best Technical Education Award’ 2018-19 at the Schoolscompared Top School Awards. The International School Awards Sunmarke was a finalist in The International School Awards 2019 in the ‘Initiative to Support Inclusion’ category for our peer-coaching sports programme, Sports Heroes Academy. Mother, Baby & Child We also won three Mother, Baby & Child Awards for ‘Best New School’, ‘Brand of the Year’ and also the Silver for ‘Secondary School of the Year’ 2018.

Wellbeing Sunmarke School | British Curriculum Dubai Wellbeing About > Wellbeing Sunmarke's Wellbeing Zone Promotion Of A Healthy Body And Mind For A Healthy Life True wellbeing entails taking care of all aspects of your life including what you eat, where you move, how you sleep to your thoughts and feelings. On our wellbeing page you will find articles, guided practices and information on varied subjects that will help you on your own wellness journey. FOR OUR STUDENTS School, studies, friendships, and relationships can be exciting, enjoyable, overwhelming, and stressful. It is incredibly important to take care of yourself physically through mindful eating, exercising, and getting enough sleep, as well as mentally from a social and emotional perspective. These mindful colouring sheets can be used as calming activities with you and your family DISCOVER MORE Try these breathing and brain break activities DISCOVER MORE FOR OUR PARENTS We understand that sometimes it takes a community to get it right. To ensure that our students have a comprehensive support system, we have compiled some helpful links and resources that will guide you in assisting your children with the various challenges they encounter, as well as the crucial practice of self-care. This resource aids children in expressing and recognising their emotions DISCOVER MORE This resource provides top tips when supporting children with anxiety DISCOVER MORE FOR OUR STAFF As educators and caretakers, the responsibility of health is not limited to others, it is as important to pay attention to your own physical, social and emotional wellbeing. Here are 6 exercises to try that will increase your positive emotions and wellbeing DISCOVER MORE Experience the power of gratitude. Download your own Gratitude Journal DISCOVER MORE Try this simple technique that takes just a few minutes, it can help an agitated student regain the state of mind needed for learning DISCOVER MORE Contacting The Wellbeing Team The Wellbeing Team at Sunmarke School are always here to assist you. Reach out to them by ‘ Contacting School Department ’ and select your child’s name. The designated Wellbeing Department (EYFS/ Primary/ Secondary) for your child will then appear in the drop down menu, please type your message and submit. A member of the Wellbeing team will be in touch with you to see how they can best support you and your family.

Inclusion - Sunmarke School Dubai | National Curriculum of England The Achievement Centre – Inclusion Department About > The Achievement Centre – Inclusion Department The Achievement Centre – Inclusion Department Making Learning Accessible To All Inclusivity is enshrined in Sunmarke’s ethos where we welcome a diverse range of learners from EYFS to Secondary. The Achievement Centre takes the lead in providing an inclusive education to students in close collaboration with parents, teachers and external specialists. “ Jayne West Head Of Inclusion Laila is a Global Ambassador representing sports for People of Determination worldwide. She was an outstanding member of the Secondary Life Skills Class, where she gained the qualifications to be accepted into Dubai College of Leisure and Tourism further education course. We are all very proud of her as she continues to inspire our students to believe in the dream!!! To facilitate the successful participation and progress of all learners, a range of additional provisions, subject to staffing and availability, are offered at no extra cost. They include, but are not limited to: Interventions for literacy Interventions for mathematics Speaking and listening Social skills Motor skills Directed studies Extra-curricular activities specific to students with SEND (Special Educational Needs & Disabilities) Commitment to Inclusion Our school is also an accredited centre for the BTEC Introductory Awards offering a wide range of both academic and vocational units including Business Administration, Media, Health and Fitness, Leisure and Hospitality. It has a highly successful SEND department which has been commended in our most recent DSIB (Dubai School Inspection Bureau) inspection. We have developed a reliable network of external providers, who parents can contract to provide specialist assessment and therapy services at Sunmarke. These include, but are not limited to: Comprehensive developmental and diagnostic assessment Psycho-educational assessment Behavioural assessment and intervention Occupational Therapy and Sensory Integration assessment and intervention Speech and Language Therapy assessment and intervention Personalised support from a 1:1 Learning Support Assistant Fortes English Language Programme The Fortes English Language Programme is an intensive programme of cross curricular, full immersion pedagogy, with a focus on academic English, alongside every day language and culture. Students learn language alongside new skills and all within a broad range of subjects and activities such as Art, Drama, PE and Sport, Music in addition to the usual core subjects. Students experience accelerated language acquisition and achieve a deeper understanding of subject-specific English across the curriculum. For more information about inclusion at Sunmarke, please download our Inclusion Policies and Inclusion Procedures below: Inclusion Policy Inclusion & Students of Determination Procedures Dubai Inclusive Education Policy Framework UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and Optional Protocol Federal Law No. (29) of 2006 Concerning the Rights of People of Determination Dubai Inclusive Education Policy Framework 2017 Implementing the Education Policy Framework Dubai Inclusive Education Policy Framework 2017 (Arabic) Implementing the Education Policy Framework (Arabic) Advocating for inclusive education – A GUIDE FOR PARENTS Law No. (2) of 2014 Concerning Protection of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in the Emirate of Dubai

Sunmarke Campus Facilities | British School in Dubai | International School Our Campus About > Our Campus Our Campus Our vibrant and elegantly developed school is located in a quiet area in Jumeirah Village Triangle, Dubai, close to several residential communities. We have one of the largest and most innovatively designed campuses in the region – big enough to offer a wide range of facilities, yet a space that feels decidedly friendly, warm and connected. Our learning spaces allow for unlimited opportunities for study and reflection, as well as interaction and expression, sports, play and recreation.

Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke Our Approach Learning > Nursery > Our Approach Our Approach Dubai’s Most Loved Early Childhood Centre - Where Each Day Brings A New Learning Adventure Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke’s campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School. With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners. Nursery School in Dubai Areas of Learning JINS’ unique educational framework blends the World-Class British EYFS Curriculum with Reggio-Emilia, The Curiosity Approach and Montessori principles to bring hands-on learning experiences to life. Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery. Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude. These seven areas of learning are essential for your child’s healthy development and form the core framework of our educational programmes: 3 Core Areas of Learning Physical Development Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development 4 Specific Areas of Learning Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Extraordinary Indoor & Outdoor Spaces With 9 vibrant branches in Dubai, JINS provides rich learning environments that ignite children’s imagination and stimulate endless moments of discovery and exploration. Our nature-inspired Early Childhood Centre in the heart of the JVT community offers stimulating and engaging spaces where every detail is crafted to inspire and nurture young minds. Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas. Learning Through Play Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‘learn through play’ and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We’re committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‘Transition Days’ children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child’s development and preparation for life in the modern world, it’s also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they’ll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. JINS Awards & Recognitions JINS’ unique approach to early years education, innovative facilities and best teaching practices has gained recognition from parents and other distinguished platforms in the region. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Gulf News and Being She Lifetime Achievement Award – Mrs. Mankani, Founder of JINS Our visionary and esteemed Founder, Mrs. Shakuntala Mankani, has been honoured with the Lifetime Achievement Award at the prestigious Gulf News and Being She Excellence Awards 2024. Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke Our Approach Learning > Nursery > Our Approach Our Approach Dubai’s Most Loved Early Childhood Centre - Where Each Day Brings A New Learning Adventure Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke’s campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School. With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners. Nursery School in Dubai Areas of Learning JINS’ unique educational framework blends the World-Class British EYFS Curriculum with Reggio-Emilia, The Curiosity Approach and Montessori principles to bring hands-on learning experiences to life. Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery. Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude. These seven areas of learning are essential for your child’s healthy development and form the core framework of our educational programmes: 3 Core Areas of Learning Physical Development Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development 4 Specific Areas of Learning Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Extraordinary Indoor & Outdoor Spaces With 9 vibrant branches in Dubai, JINS provides rich learning environments that ignite children’s imagination and stimulate endless moments of discovery and exploration. Our nature-inspired Early Childhood Centre in the heart of the JVT community offers stimulating and engaging spaces where every detail is crafted to inspire and nurture young minds. Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas. Learning Through Play Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‘learn through play’ and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We’re committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‘Transition Days’ children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child’s development and preparation for life in the modern world, it’s also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they’ll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. EYFS - Early Years Curriculum for FS1 & FS2 | Sunmarke School Dubai Early Years Curriculum Learning > EYFS > Early Years Curriculum Early Years Curriculum Setting The Foundation For A Fulfilling Educational Journey Sunmarke’s Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) offers a broad and balanced curriculum for our youngest students aged 3 to 5 years, once again proving its credentials as one of the best British curriculum schools in Dubai. Children acquire new skills through 7 areas of learning and development. In the initial stages, three Prime Areas are in focus: Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language Development. Growing up, the Prime Areas help develop skills in 4 Specific Areas: Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Laying the Foundations for Lifelong Learning in FS1 and FS2 At Sunmarke, our Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS), comprising FS1 (Nursery) and FS2 (Reception) , offers a broad, balanced, and enriching curriculum for children aged 3 to 5. Rooted in the British curriculum and recognised as one of Dubai’s leading EYFS providers, our programme nurtures each child’s unique strengths and interests through play-based, inquiry-led learning. A Curriculum Designed Around the Whole Child The EYFS curriculum at FS1 and FS2 is structured around seven key areas of learning and development: Prime Areas (Early Focus): Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language These areas are particularly emphasised in FS1 , helping our youngest learners develop the essential foundations of confidence, relationships, movement, and communication. Specific Areas (Building on the Foundations): Literacy Mathematics Understanding the World Expressive Arts and Design As children progress into FS2 , these specific areas become more prominent, supporting emerging literacy and numeracy skills, creative expression, and a growing awareness of the world. Characteristics of Effective Learning Across FS1 and FS2, we recognise that children learn in different ways. The EYFS framework promotes three key learning characteristics: Playing and Exploring: Investigating and experiencing, ‘having a go’ Active Learning: Concentrating, persevering, and celebrating achievement Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing ideas, making connections, and problem-solving These traits guide how learning is planned and delivered across both FS1 and FS2, ensuring that each child’s development is supported in a way that reflects their interests, needs, and learning styles. Learning Through Play and Projects At Sunmarke, we view play as a powerful vehicle for learning in both FS1 and FS2. Our curriculum is intentionally designed to offer rich, purposeful play experiences that allow children to explore, imagine, and make sense of the world in a way that is meaningful to them. In FS1 , children are encouraged to investigate through hands-on exploration, sensory play, and open-ended experiences that develop early communication, social, and physical skills. As they transition into FS2 , children engage in more structured yet still playful learning that builds early literacy and numeracy skills while continuing to promote creativity and curiosity. Our project-based learning approach further enhances engagement. Each term, both FS1 and FS2 children explore exciting, inquiry-led themes such as “I Believe I Can Fly,” “Somewhere Out There,” and “Up, Up and Away.” These projects spark imagination and are shaped by the children’s own interests and questions, creating a deep sense of ownership and wonder. Whether FS1 children are building a fairy tale castle or FS2 pupils are investigating the planets, our environments are carefully curated to provide challenge, joy, and discovery. Through child-initiated and adult-guided activities, children develop critical thinking, collaboration, and communication—the building blocks of future learning. A Holistic and Nurturing Approach At Sunmarke, we believe that every child in FS1 and FS2 is a unique individual. Our holistic approach to early education goes beyond academics to nurture each child’s emotional, social, physical, and intellectual development. We incorporate globally respected early years methodologies including elements of the Reggio Emilia philosophy , Montessori principles , and the Curiosity Approach . This eclectic framework values child-led exploration, independence, and a strong connection to the learning environment—creating rich opportunities for discovery and expression. Our learning spaces are thoughtfully designed to be calm, beautiful, and engaging, reflecting the importance of the environment as the ‘third teacher’. Teachers and support staff observe closely, respond sensitively, and plan responsively to extend learning in authentic, meaningful ways. Strong partnerships with parents, a passionate team of educators, and a shared belief in the limitless potential of every child create a warm, supportive community. In FS1 and FS2, children feel safe, seen, and inspired—laying a confident foundation for their journey through school and life. Characteristics of Effective Learning The characteristics of Effective Learning describe how children learn and respond to teaching in the Foundation Stage, a factor determined by their individual learning characteristic. Three traits of effective teaching and learning identified by the EYFS are: Playing and Exploring: Finding out, discovering, willing to ‘have a go’ and playing with what they know Active Learning: Being involved and concentrating, trying and persevering, taking pleasure from achievements Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing their own ideas, making links and selecting their own ways to complete tasks 7 Curriculum Areas To enhance the learning experience and make it impactful, Sunmarke has selected 7 curriculum areas taught through unique projects and interests, most of which are child-initiated activities that incorporate elements of imagination, investigation and ‘out of the box’ ideas, concepts and solutions. The EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play which enhances critical thinking abilities, fuels risk-taking and creative skills. Examples of topics are ‘I believe I can fly’, ‘Somewhere out there’ and ‘Up up and away.’ The initiative EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play. Our teaching philosophy is designed to treat all children as unique individuals in their own right. Our holistic approach towards education ensures that parents/carers, class teachers, specialist teachers and learning assistants work very effectively together to support our firm belief that ‘every child is unique’. Our maxim is that happy and well-motivated children are good learners. The Foundation Stage is a safe, secure and friendly environment for our youngest children to gain confidence and independence, as they prepare for the next stage of schooling. It is a foundation for future learning. Characteristics of Effective Learning (CoEL) are a revived element in the current Early Years Foundation Stage Curriculum (EYFS). CoEL advocates that while planning and guiding children’s activities, practitioners must reflect on the different ways that students learn, and these lessons must be reflected in their practice.

EYFS Sunmarke, Dubai - Laying The Foundations For A Lifelong Love Of Learning Our Approach Learning > EYFS > Our Approach EYFS Curriculum Our Approach Laying The Foundations For A Lifelong Love Of Learning A child’s journey of education begins in the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) department at Sunmarke. Blending a range of outstanding Early Years practices from the best international schools, we commit to a child-initiated learning approach and a sophisticated play-based curriculum that enables students to fulfil their unique potential. Sunmarke’s Amazing Philosophy and Journey A- Autonomy: Children are central to everything we do; all projects stem directly from their interests. M – Mindset: In line with Sunmarke’s ‘Positive Education’ ethos, we teach children to have a ‘Growth Mindset’, encouraging endless possibilities. A- Academics: We provide a broad, balanced yet innovative British curriculum based on the Early Years Foundation Stage, building the bedrock for the future. Z -Zest: Happiness is a key agenda at Sunmarke School; we truly believe that if a child is happy and enthusiastic, they learn better. I – Individuality: Our personalised curriculum ensures every child’s individuality is recognised. Strong teacher/pupil relationships allows tutors to identify and cater to a child’s interests, strengths and challenges. N – Nurture: We nurture every child to enable them to grow and reach their fullest potential. G – Grow: Every child that enters EYFS has a special and incredible journey that helps them grow and develop into happy, healthy teens. Learning Through Play Imaginative and creative play is how children learn about the world. During imaginative play, they manipulate materials, express themselves verbally and non-verbally, plan, act, interact, react and try different roles. Learning is most effective when children participate in creative play with dolls, vehicles, blocks, rocks, cardboard, or boxes. Employing creative thinking while manipulating play dough, creating recipes by mixing dirt and water, working with art materials, splashing in puddles, or pretending to fly can further child development. Imagination fosters cognitive and social development by allowing children to contemplate different resolutions, thus boosting their self-confidence. Our Early Years Foundation Stage has been rated as ‘ Outstanding ’ in the latest KHDA’s DSIB inspection report (2023-24) with ‘ Outstanding Personal Development & Learning Skills and Outstanding Curriculum and Curriculum Adaptation’.

EYFS - Enriched Learning Programme at Sunmarke, Dubai Enriched Learning Learning > EYFS > Enriched Learning Enriched Learning An Opportunity To Enhance Students' Skills Beyond The Classroom Sunmarke offers an exciting after-school programme led by our experienced EYFS teachers and support staff. The Active Minds Programme is available Monday to Thursday, 1.30 pm to 5 pm with enough flexibility. MORE ABOUT THE ACTIVE MINDS PROGRAMME Active Minds offers a wide range of activities and multiple classes for children from FS1 to Year 2. This programme gives them the opportunity to collaborate, investigate, explore and socialise with a large circle of peers. A typical Active Minds afternoon would be as follows: Children remain with their class teacher for enrichment activities before lunch at 1:30pm. Post lunch, they begin their first activity which could be creative crafts, music and movement, gardening, STEAM activities or languages. They visit the library, take part in some outdoor activities or spend some time being digital detectives. Activities and Clubs At Sunmarke, participation in extra-curricular activities, be it in sports, creative arts or music, is as important as academic achievement. This philosophy is at the core of our Extra Curricular Activities (ECAs) within the EYFS department that offers students interesting experiences in a supporitve environment. Here is a list of the paid enrichment activities provided by our trusted external agencies to children after school: Football with Eagles Sports Kids Tennis with Unlimited Sports Dance with Ignite Mini Mixed Martial Arts with Power 4 Sports Academy Russian lessons with Headway French lessons with Headway

Primary Schools - Best Primary School Near You in Dubai Our Approach Learning > Primary > Our Approach Primary School Our Approach A Nerve Centre of Innovative and Compelling Learning Opportunities Sunmarke’s Primary phase nurtures a child’s development in all aspects, with teachers committed to knowing your child as an individual and making them feel valued and respected. The British curriculum subjects are taught in a creative and engaging manner alongside the mandated UAE subjects, with students immersed in a STEAM curriculum that enables them to make purposeful connections between all areas of their learning. Thinking Skills Extensive facilities that befit great international schools, an engaging learning environment, future-focused programmes, rewards for achievements and individual attention help students build confidence. In Key Stage 1 (KS1), we nurture a growth mindset and introduce students to more formal learning. They achieve greater self-reliance, effective study habits and learn to work and collaborate with others. In Key Stage 2 (KS2), we foster confident and competent learners as well as good communicators. Students develop self-discipline and independence as well as respect, humility and compassion for others. Leadership Sunmarke places great importance in cultivating student leadership. Primary Schools - Best Primary School Near You in Dubai Primary Curriculum Learning > Primary > Primary Curriculum Primary School Primary Curriculum A Curriculum Underpinned by our Positive Education Ethos Philosophy At Sunmarke, we firmly believe in equipping our students with the skills they’ll need in the ever-changing landscape of 21st Century thinking and work. We do this by empowering our students through an innovative and character-building education that inspires them to thrive and achieve with purpose. Our curriculum design serves to reflect this. Whilst maintaining academic rigour through the British National Curriculum, our holistic Positive Education ethos and ambitious commitment to innovative technology ensures our children achieve outstanding academic, social and personal success. Additionally, opportunities for Forest School lessons and outdoor learning are provided to all Primary students. Therefore, the drivers for our curriculum are based on two principles: all learning is purposeful with real-life application and context; and students can make connections across interdisciplinary skills. STEAM With the opening of our dedicated STEAM Centre, SPACE-X, and the addition of specialist resident design technology and computing teachers, we have redesigned our curriculum to take us from our thematic roots to design thinking, using the Stanford d.school approach below. Whilst English and maths remain explicitly on the timetable, children work on STEAM theme projects across science, design technology, engineering, the arts, maths and humanities, with the option to also make purposeful links to our UAE moral, social and cultural studies and Values in Action objectives . Living in the UAE, it is vital we also make purposeful links to our local surroundings, Islamic culture and Arabic language. This hands-on approach to problem-solving enables each STEAM theme to culminate in a proposed project which requires the students to design/make/create something which draws upon the knowledge and skills which they have learnt over the course of the project . During each STEAM project , each class will spend two weeks in SPACE-X, where the support of our specialists will enable children’s designs to come to life. Primary Core Subjects Primary Foundation Subjects English History Mathematics Geography STEAM (including science) Modern Foreign languages (MFL): French/Mandarin Arabic Art & Design Islamic Computing Values in Action/moral, social and cultural studies Music Physical Education (including swimming) In addition to the subjects above, Sunmarke offers a diverse range of sports, co-curricular and enrichment activities to supplement the academic programme.

Sports & PE at Primary School in Sunmarke, Dubai Sports & PE Learning > Primary > Sports & PE Sports & PE ‘Teamwork makes the dream work!’ is the motto of our sporting heroes at Sunmarke Primary At Sunmarke School, our world-class PE department offers a diverse range of squads and teams, providing students with ample opportunities to excel in various sports. Whether your child aspires to be a top footballer or a champion swimmer, Sunmarke nurtures their ambitions and helps turn their dreams into reality. Our commitment to sporting excellence is evident in our recent achievements. In March 2024, our primary students clinched first place overall at the prestigious U11 British Schools in the Middle East (BSME) Games. This remarkable feat included victories in girls’ football, athletics, and boys’ basketball, highlighting the dedication and talent of our young athletes. For students who enjoy sports and fitness but prefer a non-competitive environment, we offer a variety of clubs and activities designed to enhance their physical well-being. Our passionate and dedicated PE staff work diligently to build each child’s stamina and resilience, ensuring they perform at their highest level. With state-of-the-art facilities, Sunmarke provides an environment where every student can thrive.

Creative & Performing Arts - Sunmarke Primary School, Dubai Creative & Performing Arts Learning > Primary > Creative & Performing Arts Creative & Performing Arts A Creative Hub to Shape Students' Artistic and Aesthetic Sensibilities Our classes in music, art, computing, languages, PE and others are carefully planned to match each year group’s STEAM projects wherever possible. They also embrace our Positive Education ethos and make meaningful links with moral, social and cultural studies objectives. Students are taught to appreciate art and design from different periods, created by famous composers, engineers, linguists and sporting heroes. This enhances their knowledge of form, texture, pitch, tone, coding and robotics, pronunciation and composition, and timing and precision. These skills are further built upon in ECAs, including our Performing Arts elective that prepares students for the annual musical performance. Stimulating displays in classrooms and corridors result in widespread appreciation of their achievements and efforts throughout the year. Music There is something for everyone in Sunmarke’s music department. Our specialist music teachers ignite every child’s passion for music, be they a grade 7 pianist or an enthusiast in different musical genres. Students are encouraged to perform as much as possible: in assemblies, concerts, school productions – our school is their stage! See the highlight pictures below from our previous musical, which brought High School Musical to life with our talented Primary students. Stay tuned for this year’s spectacular production of Roald Dahl’s Matilda the Musical ! Performances There are many opportunities for students to shine on stage at Sunmarke Primary, with a vibrant calendar of performances that celebrate creativity, confidence and collaboration. Each year, our students captivate audiences through a wide range of events: Winter Performances: Our Year 1 and 2 students take to the stage to share a heart-warming mix of songs, poems and dances, reflecting their learning journeys from Term 1. Snowmarke: A much-anticipated concert-style showcase, Snowmarke features selected students from Years 3 to 6 performing music, dance and drama with exceptional flair. Summer Showcases: Year 3 4 and 5 students take audiences on a musical journey inspired by their curriculum, with original performances that highlight their creativity and enthusiasm. Primary Musical: A highlight of the year, our annual musical sees Year 5 and 6 students audition, rehearse and perform in a full-scale production. Recent shows have included Beauty & The Beast , Peter Pan (and upcoming Matilda Jr) , demonstrating the incredible talent and commitment of our young performers.

Secondary Schools - Best Secondary School in Dubai Near You Our Approach Learning > Secondary > Our Approach Secondary School in Dubai Our Approach Our Secondary school is alive with activity from dawn until dusk – as students pursue their ambitions in the classroom and beyond. Seamless Transition Sunmarke Secondary School ensures that students have a smooth transition from Primary to Secondary school to succeed in the next phase of their academic journey. To make the experience less daunting, our staff works closely with families. Our transition programme from Primary to Secondary school ensures that they start Year 7 full of excitement and with minimal nervousness. This section contains important and up-to-date information about our transition programme. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact Ms Young (Deputy Head – Student Opportunity) or Mr Matthews (Head of Year 7). Transitioning Into Secondary We strive to do our utmost to ensure that the transition from Year 6 to Year 7 is as smooth and welcoming as possible. Days for Your Diary Upcoming activities: Secondary pastoral leaders visit Year 6 children in their classrooms to hold informal Q&A sessions. Parent Coffee Mornings are held in Term Two and Three to learn more about the Secondary School and how to support your children with the transition process. This is an opportunity to meet key members of staff such as the Secondary Leadership Team. During the summer term, children will have the opportunity to experience Secondary Taster lessons. This will give them the chance to meet some of our secondary school staff and experience this part of the school building. More information and timings for the above events will be available soon via VLE. Approach To Learning In Secondary Our approach encourages students to build the skills and learning habits to become independent thinkers – preparing them for life way beyond Year 13. Thinking Skills At Sunmarke through our ‘Positive Education’ inclusive approach, students are enabled to flourish in a safe, happy and nurturing learning environment. They are stretched and challenged to ask and develop their own questions to harness their potential to the maximum. Opportunities are provided through numerous activities undertaken in the classroom, on the sports field, on stage, through educational visits abroad, organising charity events, or representing the school as outstanding ambassadors. Leadership There are numerous opportunities for leadership from informal roles within the classroom to formal roles outside of the classroom e.g. Prefects, School and Community Ambassadors. Students can aspire to leadership roles within and outside their year groups. These roles are designed to promote excellence while enabling student leaders to play a role in the development of the school and community. The Student Hub within the Secondary School is a dedicated space for secondary students to meet with their Student Leadership Team. At Sunmarke we believe in student voice and the sharing of ideas. The Hub provides a platform for every student to be heard and to interact with their Student Leaders. Digital Learning Sunmarke students are adept at using technology through class assignment and quizzes, home learning, submission and assessments, online collaboration and communication between students and teachers, tracking progress and behaviour and access to school resources, library books and information. We promote and sustain a culture that encourages the integration of digital technologies into all areas of the curriculum. Students engage and collaborate with their peers using a variety of digital environments and tools. Cyber-safety is an integral part of how the school community works with everyone being aware of their digital responsibilities, modelling ethical and appropriate use of digital resources. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) here . Social Responsibility Our principled, creative and innovative learning environment encourages students to have a responsibility ‘for’ and ‘towards’ the community. They learn to be solution-focused, discuss controversial topics, share their opinions on what they learn, ask questions and engage in dialogue. Environment and Sustainability Sustainability is a key agenda at Sunmarke School. We believe that we have a shared responsibility as citizens of the world to choose sustainable practices and we empower our students to do the same. Below are just some of the ways we incorporate the environment and sustainability within our subjects. Media – Sunmarke’s Media students focus on projects related to sustainable transportation, the effects of pollution and draw upon the beauty of nature and landscapes when building their portfolios. Economics – Our Business and Economics courses cover topics such as economic growth vs development, effects of trade and globalisation, the impact of deforestation etc. Students are encouraged to research policies to solve urgent environmental issues. The Sciences – A Level and IB Biology – Both courses include the study of ecosystems, ecology and biodiversity. Secondary students also look into the sustainability of using earth’s resources and assess the impact of extracting, using and recycling. Global Outlook Our excellent, holistic education and team of dedicated teachers place values like honesty, responsibility, tolerance and respect for the rights of others irrespective of nationality, gender, culture or religion at the foundation of learning. This provides students the skills and knowledge to meet the challenges of the future. Our high-quality education and multi-pathway model with bespoke career paths guide them to find the most appropriate route to study their favourite subjects at the university of their choice.

Secondary Schools - Best Senior Secondary School in Dubai Near You Secondary Curriculum Learning > Secondary > Secondary Curriculum Secondary School Secondary Curriculum Subject Offerings Rooted in STEAM ( Science, Technology, Engineering, Art & Mathematics) and Creative Learning Our innovative curriculum prepares students to make the right choices in Year 10. As an inclusive school, Sunmarke offers a wide range of options at Key Stage 4. Through offering GCSE, IGCSE, and BTEC courses, we are able to accommodate a wide range of learning styles, whilst ensuring the level of challenge is such that all post-16 pathways remain open to students. GCSE examinations are the mainstay of an English education, with most students following this pathway. At Sunmarke we also offer IGCSE examinations; the ‘I’ stands for international and means the course has been adapted to suit a more international student body. The difficulty level of GCSE and IGCSE exams are the same, but the content of GCSE examinations is more English-centred. A good example of this would be in Business Studies where the case studies for a GCSE would be UK companies, which many of our students would not have heard of. This is why we follow the IGCSE pathway for Business Studies, meaning the case studies focus on large multi-national companies all our students would know. BTEC courses are as challenging as GCSE course but are assessed in a different manner. All BTEC courses are coursework based, with students undertaking assessed units every 12 weeks or so, these are all graded, and the outcome is the sum of these assessments. BTEC courses suit students who prefer to ‘chunk’ their assessments rather than taking one or two summative exams at the end of the course which determine their final outcome. Compulsory subjects and options choices All students study the core subjects of English, Mathematics, Science, Arabic, Games and Moral, Social Cultural Studies. In addition to these core subjects, students also select four additional subjects from our extensive list of optional subjects. Each of these subjects is listed below with a brief outline of the course content and the method of assessment. Students who have been identified as requiring individual support will have their number of subjects reduced to allow for intervention. Arabic A What is involved? In Arabic, students will learn to speak, listen, read, write and communicate effectively in Arabic, as well as develop awareness and understanding of countries and communities where Arabic is spoken. How will I be assessed? This Edexcel International GCSE in Arabic (First Language) qualification comprises two external written assessed papers. Paper 1, written examination, 70% of the total International GCSE marks, 2 hours 15 minutes, which includes 10 minutes’ recommended reading time. 70 marks Paper 2, written examination, produce two pieces of continuous writing. Students will Choose two titles from a choice of six 1 hour 30 minutes. 60 marks Grammatical usage which will be tested in Paper 1, Section 3 This course will also be supplemented with Ministry of Education assessments for Arab students. Arabic B What does it involve? Paper 1: Listening and Understanding in Arabic Students are assessed on their understanding of standard spoken Arabic in a variety of scenarios. Students will need to identify the overall message, key points, details and opinions, deduce meaning from a variety of spoken areas. The paper draws on vocabulary and structures across all themes. And students are presented with recorded scenarios involving one or more speakers in public and social settings, and the resources are authentic. Paper 2: Speaking in Arabic Students are assessed on their ability to communicate and interact through speaking in Arabic for different purposes in different settings. They will be assessed on 3 tasks: Task 1: Role play/ -Task 2 Picture-based task/Task 3: Conversation Paper 3: Reading and Understanding in Arabic Students are assessed on their understanding of written Arabic across a range of different types of texts. Scenarios in the texts are set either at home or, more frequently , in Arabic –speaking country, allowing students to develop appropriate cultural awareness and understanding. This paper draws on vocabulary and structures across all the themes. To be ready , there should be a variety of different contexts as appropriate to their age and level of understanding. Paper 4: Writing in Arabic The student are assessed on their ability to communicate effectively through writing in Arabic. Students need to: Communicate effectively in writing for a variety purpose across a range of specified contexts. Write short texts using simple sentences and familiar language accurately, make independent, creative and more complex use of words, translate sentences and short texts from English into the assessed language, apply grammatical rules Art & Design What does it involve? Alongside improving your practical expertise, you’ll learn how to: Develop, refine and record your ideas Present a personal response that realises your intentions Improve your creative skills through the effective and safe use of media, materials, techniques, processes and technologies Successfully use visual language and the formal elements eg colour, line, form, shape, tone, texture Use drawing skills for different needs and purposes. Unit 1 — Personal Portfolio in Art and Design (60% of total GCSE) Unit 2 — Externally Set Assignment (40% of total GCSE) How will I be assessed? During the course you will produce a portfolio (60% of final mark). In Y11 at the start of term 2 you will begin an externally set assignment (40% of final mark). As part of the externally set assignment you will sit a 10 hour (across 2 days) supervised unaided practical exam. Business What is involved? Students apply their knowledge and understanding to different business contexts ranging from small enterprises to large multinationals and businesses operating in local, national and global contexts. Students develop an understanding of how these contexts impact on business behavior. Students will apply their knowledge and understanding to business decision making including: The interdependent nature of business activity, influences on business, business operations, finance, marketing and human resources, and how these interdependencies underpin business decision making How different business contexts affect business decisions The use and limitation of quantitative and qualitative data in making business decisions How will I be assessed? Paper 1: Influences of operations and human resources on business activity (50% of the IGCSE) Paper 2: Influences of marketing and finance on business activity (50% of the IGCSE) BTEC Level 2 Business What does it involve? Students should be interested in learning about the aspects of the business world around them, how businesses are set up and what makes a great entrepreneur. Through selected modules, students will be given a wider understanding of the large range of Business specialisms. How will I be assessed? Students will be assessed through well-defined assignments set from actual criteria, which is 100% coursework based. The assignments will be assessed through internal and external assessments on this 2 year course. The assessments will lead to grading of either Pass, Merit or Distinction, and students will have the opportunity to use differing mediums to demonstrate their creativity. Units 1 – 3 are mandatory and the unit 5 is optional. Computer Science What does it involve? Paper 1: Theory Concepts & Principles of Computer Science Paper 2: Problem Solving & Programming Knowledge and understanding of the key concepts and principles of computer science. length of exam: 1 hour 45mins. 75 marks 60% weighting. The course will engage you through encouraging creativity, with a focus on practical work that reflects twenty-first century Theatre practise. You will develop your practical and analytical skills through the perspectives of a performer, director and designer of Theatre. How is it assessed? You will be assessed through three components. Component 1: Devising 40% (60 marks) Creating a devised performance from stimulus. (15 marks) Analyze and evaluate the devising process and performance (45 marks) Component 2: Performance from a text (20%) 48 marks Perform two key extracts from a performance text. The subject content looks at economic activity through the lens of the consumers, producers, and governments. Students will be covering economics in individual countries and the global economy. IGCSE Economics is designed as a two-year course for teaching in international schools such as Sunmarke. As students go through the course they are presented with opportunities to focus on real-world issues. Students should consider and reflect upon moral, ethical and sustainable issues that arise as a result of the impact of economic activity. How will I be assessed? Paper 1: Microeconomics & Business Economics Both 1 hour 30 minutes. Both have a 50% weighting of the qualification A mixture of multiple choice, short answer, data-response and open-ended questions Paper: Macroeconomics & the Global Economy English Language What does it involve? Students will study texts from: The contemporary non-fiction texts from Part 1 of the Pearson Edexcel International GCSE English Anthology. Any two poetry or prose texts from Part 2 of the Pearson Edexcel International GCSE English Anthology. A range of different text types so they can match the style and purpose for a creative piece and for their examination. How will I be assessed? Paper 1: Examination The contemporary non-fiction texts from Part 1 of the Pearson Edexcel International GCSE English Anthology. Weighting 60 % of the IGCSE – 90 marks. Priestly Of Mice and Men – John Steinbeck A collection of poetry from the Edexcel anthology How will I be assessed? Paper 1: Modern Prose and Poetry examination Weighting 60% of the IGCSE – 90 marks Examination paper – 2hrs Examination paper consists of 3 sections: Section A: Unseen Poetry, Section B: Poetry collection, Section C: Of Mice and Men Paper 3: Literary Heritage and Modern Drama coursework 40% of the IGCSE – 60 marks. There are two coursework tasks worth 30 marks each. Assignment A: An Inspector Calls, Assignment B: Macbeth Food Preparation And Nutrition What does it involve? Year 10 focuses upon developing students’ knowledge and understanding of the key topics, as outlined below, in readiness to undertake their Non-Exam Assessments in Year 11. The topics we will study are: Food, nutrition and health Food science Food safety Food choice Food provenance How will I be assessed? There are two Non-Exam Assessments (NEA) which are completed in year 11. The first, NEA1, is a food investigation task focusing on the Food Science topic, particularly nutrition and functions of ingredients. It is a written report (1,500-2,000 words) including photographic evidence of practical experiments. NEA1 is worth 15% of the overall grade. The second, NEA2, is a food preparation task focusing on practical skills as well as food safety, food choice and food provenance topics. Students will prepare, cook and present several dishes, to demonstrate complex cooking skills, before preparing a final menu of three dishes, which will be cooked within a three hour practical exam. The three dishes are presented in a ‘MasterChef’ style where they are assessed by the teachers and the class. NEA2 is worth 35% of the overall grade. The written exam at the end of year 11 encompasses the five topics identified above. The exam consists of 20 multiple choice questions and five extended writing questions, each with a number of sub questions. Students will have 1 hour 45minutes to complete the exam and it is worth 50% of the overall grade. French What is involved? Students of our GCSE in French will learn to speak, listen, read, write and communicate effectively in French, as well as develop awareness and understanding of countries and communities where French is spoken. How will I be assessed? Unit 1: Listening and Understanding in French (25%) Students will be tested on their ability to understand spoken French. Testing is through a variety of tasks which require a response, written or non-verbal, to demonstrate understanding. Unit 2: Speaking in French (25%) Students must demonstrate the ability to use the French language for different purposes and in different settings and will be assessed in one final exam where they will have to respond to unseen questions, take part in role plays, respond to a stimulus and give a presentation. Unit 3: Reading and Understanding in French (25%) This unit draws on vocabulary and structures from across the three specified common topic areas. Students will be tested on their ability to understand written French. Paper 1 30% Medicine Paper 2 40% Elizabeth & Cold War Paper 3 30% Weimar and Nazi Germany ICT What does it involve? There will be 6 topics to undertake over a 2 year programme. You will complete the following 4 units. Communicating in the IT industry – using IT tools to communicate and exchange information. You will also look at the impacts of IT on individuals, communities and society. Some units have a variety of ways in which you are assessed and others may have only one way. The BTEC Level 2 IT is graded at Pass, Merit, Distinction or Distinction*. The overall number of points you achieve determines your overall grade. Mathematics What does it involve? IGCSE Mathematics is entirely assessed by written examination. The written examination will consist of two papers which are each worth one half of the final mark. Both papers are worth 50% each and are 2 hours each. Each exam is worth 100 marks. Both papers allow the use of a calculator. The papers can be taken at Higher Tier (Grades 9-3) or Foundation Tier (Grades 5-1).
