Sports & PE at Secondary School in Sunmarke, Dubai Sports & PE Learning > Secondary > Sports & PE Sports & PE A Celebration of Victory And Achievements On The Sporting Field Our students enjoy an extensive timetabled programme for PE including Health-related fitness, Swimming, Badminton, Table Tennis, Trampolining, Cricket, Rounders and Athletics. This offer is further enhanced by our Games Programme which gives students exposure to competitive team sports such as Football, Touch Rugby, Basketball, Netball, Volleyball, and Handball alongside further opportunities for developing health and fitness. Representing the school at any of these sports is a sought-after honour. We often have returning students coming back to school and speaking with pride about times they played in sports fixtures at Sunmarke. Specialist Team In addition to our committed PE staff, we enlist specialist coaching to strengthen the Games Programme and motivate students to engage in competitions at the local, regional, and national levels. Our teams, known as the Spartans, compete in events organised by DASSA and DAPSA, which are Dubai sports organisations, as well as the British Schools in the Middle East (BSME). World-class Facilities On-site, we have a full-sized and a 5-a-side Astroturf pitch, along with MUGA courts outdoors for multi-sport use. Indoors, we have two Multi-Purpose Sports halls, a dance studio, a gymnasium, a 25m swimming pool, and a learner swimming pool. Sunmarke's House System All students at Sunmarke school are members of one of our houses: Lions, Tigers, Leopards & Panthers. These houses continue to promote team spirit within our community. Throughout the school, students regularly participate in house competitions where they can earn flourish points, leading to both personal and group recognition. In secondary school, students are acknowledged for their contributions to their houses by taking part in house competitions, being an engaged learner, contributing to the community, and showing care and respect for others. Every week, a student of the week is chosen in each year group and celebrated for their efforts inside and outside of the classroom. This can include a weekly tea party with our Head of Secondary School, Mr Bell. To be invited for ‘Tea with Mr. B’ is a significant moment in a year in the life of our Sunmarke students. Students are encouraged to stay updated about upcoming house competitions through internal advertising and on our dedicated Instagram page @sunmarkehousessecondary . Our current house captains are: Leopards: Olivja, Jana Tigers: Marissa, Mia Lions: Vance, Karolina Panthers: Lavanya, Moazzam Visit Sunmarke Sports Hub Visit our Sports Hub here

We have close partnerships with Camps International and Ecoventure ME that offer regional and international trips for students throughout the academic year. Sunmarke also offers The Duke of Edinburgh International Award (DofE International Award) which enriches our students’ lives with practical experiences, life skills and allows them to discover their hidden talents and capabilities. The Duke Of Edinburgh Award The Duke of Edinburgh International Award, founded in 1956 by His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh is the world’s leading youth achievement award, bringing together experiences and life skills to equip young people for life. The concept of the Award is of individual challenge designed to encourage young people between 14 and 25 to develop into responsible, active citizens who will contribute towards society. What’s involved? The Award is voluntary, non-competitive, enjoyable and balanced, and requires students to expend effort over a period of time. There are three levels to the Award: Bronze, Silver and Gold. Young people design their own Award programme, set their own goals and record their own progress. They can choose four categories: Service, Physical Recreation or a Skills activity, or go on an Expedition. Here are some more details of each segment. Service The Award gives students the opportunity to give back to the community and make a real difference to the people or wildlife/animals, or to contribute to a good cause. It acquaints students with the joy of giving. Examples include: first aid, visiting and supporting people in need, volunteering at hospitals, sports coaching, charity work, etc. Physical Recreation Physical Recreation, both individually and within a team, is a fun and healthy way of developing a real sense of achievement outside the classroom, instilling enthusiasm and feeling of wellbeing. Examples include: Ball Sports, Athletics, Water Sports, Winter Sports, Martial Arts, Animal Sports, etc. Skill The Award encourages students to learn something new as a part of the process. Whether their interests lie in skiing or photography, the Award allows them to explore their passions. Examples include: Music, Arts and Crafts, Nature and the Environment, Communication, Games and Sports and related skills, etc. The Adventurous Journey The Adventurous Journey section is about undertaking a team journey or expedition. Participants plan, train for and undertake a journey with a purpose in an unfamiliar environment. Students spend 2 days and 1 night away completing around 12 hours of purposeful effort in total. Sunmarke Gavel (Toastmasters Club ) “If you can speak, you can influence. If you can influence, you can change lives.” Toastmasters International, which has a legacy of 98 years will undoubtedly change your child’s life! At Sunmarke Gavel club, which is an affiliate of Toastmasters International, your child will get access to an International Acclaimed Public Speaking programme that will help your child get adequate public speaking skills for boosting their confidence and leadership. The program is open to students between the age of 12 to 18 years. Volunteering Opportunities Volunteering is one of the greatest gifts we can give others. Sunmarke’s student volunteers work closely with the Inclusion Department at the School to learn necessary skills to coach and assist their “buddies” during training sessions. This peer-coaching programme draws upon our school’s core values and Positive Education ethos whereby confidence, physical skills and social communication skills for our athletes are built upon.

Sixth Form Approach at Sunmarke Dubai | Sunmarke School Dubai Our Approach Learning > Sixth Form > Our Approach Sixth Form School in Dubai Our Approach Achieving Outstanding Results With The Right Balance of Support, Inspiration And Challenge Sunmarke’s Sixth Form is imbued with the Positive Education approach, our dynamic and innovative Sixth Form curriculum is designed to meet the needs, talents and interest of our students, making them future-ready. Through our different pathways, we encourage students to ask questions about the world around them and think from multiple perspectives. We are unique in offering A-Levels, BTECs, and being an IB World School, we also offer the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme. Whether students choose the A-Level, BTEC; or the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme pathway, we inspire purpose and drive passion. Here at Sunmarke we care about the journey that students go on and the skills they develop along the way. Our students are not defined by grades, they are a collection of skills and interests that show their passion, and we want them to strive to be better learners to best prepare them for the path they choose after they graduate. Students will develop these skills through sessions run in form time on developing as a learner and preparing for higher education. While attending sessions for the latter, students will be exposed to resources that will help them explore their passions through reading, videos and courses outside of the curriculum that are now available online at the click of a button. Outside of the form room is where you will differ in terms of skills developed. The International Baccalaureate Programmes places more of an emphasis in developing a variety of skills due to the diverse subjects students have to take whereas A-Levels allow students to delve deeper into a smaller selection of subjects. Different still are BTEC qualifications which have no exams and will, therefore, develop your investigation and research skills as you look to answer your briefs. Leadership All students at Sunmarke’s Sixth Form are leaders and role models and they embrace this responsibility fully. These young leaders play a crucial role in the growth of the school and the community. Within their academics, students are provided options to lead their own learning such as through the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ), available to A Level and BTEC students or through various pieces of coursework, such as the Extended Essay and Reflective Project on the International Baccalaureate pathways. There are several opportunities for students to assume leadership roles, form their own extra-curricular activities and represent the school as Senior Prefects, Senior Student Leadership Team, House Captains and Subject Ambassadors. Thinking Skills Preparing students to flourish in an environment that encourages critical and independent thinking, Sunmarke’s Sixth Form is imbued with the Positive Education approach. Students are trained through the Theory of Knowledge (TOK) curriculum that motivates them to ask questions about the world around them and think from multiple perspectives. Digital Learning Sixth Form students model the use and integration of digital technologies throughout their curriculum. Many digital tools are available such as Questia School, an online library and UniFrog, a platform for search, shortlist and applying for university courses. Sixth Form Students are taught to be at ease with technology, but also encouraged to question its validity, reliability and responsibility in a modern world. Media literacy is given a lot of importance at Sunmarke as students prepare to navigate the world beyond the school. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy here . Social Responsibility Sunmarke Sixth Formers take the lead in service, learning and providing solutions while developing collaboration, leadership and social skills. There are structured programmes for students to follow such as CAS (Creativity, Activity, Service) and Service Learning that lists a set of objectives to be used as guidance. These are ‘need and solution-based’ programmes where students can choose to give service to their peers, the school, the local community and even make a global difference. These programmes make them understand the difference they can make to the world while developing emotional intelligence. Global Outlook As an international school training students to excel globally, we foster an ethos of honesty, responsibility, tolerance and respect for others within the academic and Positive Education curriculum. Sixth Form students take a leading role in celebrations such as International Day by sharing their own cultures and traditions with the rest of the community. As a multi-pathway school, we aim to make our students global citizens. These are useful as a guide to choose the right options and also serve as a reference point throughout the two year IGCSE, GCSE or BTEC Level 2 programmes. It gives a glimpse of the areas of study within each subject that can be used to support the teaching and learning. A-Levels Sixth Form Schools in Dubai | Sunmarke School Dubai A-Levels Learning > Sixth Form > A-Levels A-Levels An Internationally Recognised Qualification Focusing On Content-Driven Academic Subjects Why study A-Levels? Advanced Level qualifications (known as A-Levels) are individual subject based qualifications. They are one option available to students who are looking to study at university. With A-Levels being standalone qualifications, there is no requirement on subject combinations and students’ only constraint is the combinations available within the school timetable. A-Levels are graded from A*-E. What does this Pathway look like? Students will usually take 3 or 4 A-Levels and this would be what universities would be looking for as offers are based mainly on 3 A-Level grades. If you are debating which subjects to choose, we recommend you start with 4 A-Levels so you can have a range to begin with which you can narrow down later. Students will receive 6 lessons per subject each week with most subjects being 100% examination-based. Subjects either fit into the category of modular A-Levels or linear A-Levels. In modular subjects, students will take up to three exams in Year 12 and up to three in Year 13 whereas, with linear A-Levels, students complete all exams at the end of Year 13. How does this Pathway lead to University? A-Levels are internationally recognised qualifications which will give you access to the most competitive universities worldwide. While taking A-Levels would give you the necessary prerequisites with regards to subjects, you may need to take further tests in English in order to study at universities where courses are delivered in English. In addition, students wishing to study certain subjects worldwide need to review the Mathematics requirements for entry into the university of their choice. What skills will I develop? Taking a combination of A-Levels will allow you to specialise in a particular area post 16 as opposed to waiting until you begin university. With few subjects having coursework components, there is a lot of focus on exam skills. However, there is the option of taking the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ) in order to develop your academic writing and research skills. Furthermore, the EPQ is a perfect opportunity for you to demonstrate and develop your interest in an area you want to go on to study at university; competitive universities are always looking for examples of students pursuing their academic passions outside of the classroom. Whether it be the other EPQ or another opportunity, we recommend you find an outlet to explore your passions through extra-curricular activities.

BTEC Programme - Business and Technology Education Council, Sunmarke BTECs Learning > Sixth Form > BTECs BTECs A Dynamic BTEC Programme Helping Students Develop Vocational Skills To Move To University Or Into Direct Employment What are BTECs? Short for Business and Technology Education Council, BTECs are a practical-based, vocational qualification which offers the same equivalence to A-Levels when converted into UCAS points. Many industry sectors have a set of National Occupational Standards that professionals must follow. The learning content of BTECs is built around these National Occupational Standards, which is why BTECs are recognised as valuable qualifications. They provide the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a field or subject and are an excellent alternative to the more theory focused A-Levels or subjects on the IB Diploma Programme. What does this Pathway look like? BTECs are taught through application with students often going on educational visits and meeting industry specialists as well as completing one week of work experience in Year 12. Assessments are via regular coursework and projects throughout the 2-year course. If you know you don’t excel in exam conditions, BTECs can relieve this pressure, spreading out the work that dictates your final grade as 100% of your final grade will come from these coursework components. Students are able to take a combination of BTECs and A-Levels in order to have a balance between hands on learning whilst also taking more traditional subjects. How does this Pathway lead to University? BTECs are equivalent to A-Levels in terms of applications to universities. However, there are some universities which don’t accept these qualifications so you would need to research the different countries you would like to apply for in order to ensure you meet the admissions criteria for your desired destination. What skills will I develop? BTECs truly prepare students for the real world, offering them practical skills to be successful in the industry of their choosing. If you enjoy practical learning and want to study a specialised range of subjects, BTECs are the perfect option for you. Within each subject, more technical skills are developed; for example, we are very proud of our BTEC Media courses that allow students to create using hi-tech equipment as students learn how to get the most out of this technology.

IB World School - IB Education | IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Learning > Sixth Form > IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Supporting Students To Compete At The Global Level The mission of the International Baccalaureate Organisation (IBO)’s programmes is to “develop inquiring, knowledgeable and caring young people who help to create a better and more peaceful world through education that builds intercultural understanding and respect.” Sunmarke offers the IB Diploma Programme as this mission aligns with our own to “Nurture the next generation of change-makers for a better tomorrow.” Through its exceptional academic and non-academic initiatives, our school grooms our students to use their education to positively influence their communities. Find out more about the details of the IB Diploma Programme at Sunmarke. What is the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme? The International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IBDP) is a holistic programme which gives you a broad post 16 education whilst also allowing you to specialise in three subjects. You will take three Standard Level subjects and three Higher Level subjects as well as the Extended Essay, Theory of Knowledge and the Creativity, Activity and Service Programme (CAS). Each subject is graded from 1-7 with the diploma core (Theory of Knowledge and Extended Essay) giving 3 more points depending on the combination of grades in these components. Students must achieve a minimum total of 24 points to pass the Diploma Programme. What does this Pathway look like? Each week you will receive lessons in your 6 subjects (typically 4 lessons for higher level and 3 for standard level) as well as lessons in Theory of Knowledge (TOK). You will also receive sessions to develop writing and research skills needed for the Extended Essay. This is a piece of academic writing where you choose the subject, topic and research question to produce an answer in a 4,000 word research report. The CAS programme is a non-graded component which encourages students to set objectives in creative, active and service experiences outside of the classroom. Each subject has a coursework component worth at least 20% meaning the whole grade does not rest on the final exams. How does this Pathway lead to University? An internationally recognised qualification, the IBDP will give you access to the most competitive universities worldwide. With the DP developing more than just subject knowledge, universities see it as a perfect higher education preparation programme. As all students study English Language and Literature, you will meet the language requirement of most universities that deliver courses in English. The IBDP programme also continues a student’s study in Mathematics. Students completing the IBDP programme continue to study Mathematics and English throughout their Secondary education and are then able to demonstrate 4 years of study in Mathematics and English during the application process. The IB Diploma, due to its holistic nature and its requirements, is highly valued by universities worldwide. What skills will I develop? Through coursework components, the Extended Essay and Theory of Knowledge, you will learn to think critically, write well constructed, balanced arguments and write using an academic structure. The CAS programme develops skills to ensure you are a well-rounded student who has lots of experiences beyond the classroom to make you really stand out in university applications and interviews. IB Diploma Programme courses options on offer at Sunmarke: English Language & Literature Environmental Systems and Societies French Spanish Psychology Business Management Visual Arts Economics Physics Biology Chemistry Maths: Analysis & Approaches Maths: Application & Interpretation Film © International Baccalaureate Organization 2018 At the core of the IB Programmes is a focus on teaching and learning, and the IB Learner Profile. The IB Learner Profile is a set of traits which the IB believes students must develop to meet the mission’s long-term goal. Throughout the two years of the programme, teachers will promote these attributes in lessons to help students become better learners which will enhance their academic journey and prepare them to be more independent after graduating from school. Below are the 10 traits that make up the IB Learner Profile.

Careers Counsellor - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Careers Counsellor Learning > Sixth Form > Careers Counsellor Careers Counsellor Specialist Staff To Guide and Inspire Students To Find The Right Career Pathway Specialist One-to-One Support Sunmarke has two full-time Careers Counsellors, who, along with Form Tutors and the Head of 6 th Form, advise students on their higher education and career path. Students works closely with these experts and parents are always welcome to speak to our Careers and University team to find a pathway suitable for their child. Through conversations and research, students can find their calling and a pathway of study that excites and enthuses. Read below to see the different opportunities and platforms we use in order to help students get excited about education outside of the Sunmarke classrooms. UNIFROG Unifrog is the career and university platform that is used at Sunmarke School. It’s an impartial, user-friendly platform that helps students to research their future pathways. It contains a repository of career lessons, information on pathways, universities around the world, CV builder, personality tests, and links to MOOCs (online courses). Unifrog is useful for students in their last four years of study but can be accessed and used by all in Secondary. Students can use the platform to start to explore the different post 18 pathways and the application process for their chosen route. Careers lessons in Y12 focus on psychometric testing, university and career research and to start working on application requirements such as personal statements and US university essays. We encourage all families to explore this platform together as early as possible in order to start the conversation as to where a student may study as well as what the course requirements are in order to make sure the right combination of subjects are being chosen post 16. There are many factors that go into shortlisting universities such as location, size, tuition fees or university housing to name just a few; with all this choice, it is important to narrow down to specific countries in Year 12 so the application process is not overwhelming in Year 13. Students work one-on-one with the university careers counsellors who assist and guide students through every step of the application process. University Destinations Sunmarke students achieve their first choice university destinations which has included UK Russel Group schools, and top Worldwide destinations such as the Imperial College London, NYU, University of Amsterdam, Bocconi, Carnegie Mellon, UCLA, UC San Diego, Georgia Tech, The University of Toronto, McGill and University of Edinburgh. For a full list of our destinations, click here . Offline University Guidance Parents are invited to join our ‘SunRise Sessions’ where they learn about different aspects of applying to universities around the world and get informed about the procedures and pathways. Our tailored programme of learning includes researching courses, writing personal statements, practising for aptitude tests and interviews, holding mock interviews and completing applications. We also host admissions teams from leading universities from around the world each year, giving students a unique opportunity to find out more about their courses and expectations. If Oxford, Cambridge or the American Ivy Leagues are in your sights, we have a specialist team to advise you. Think & Thrive Entrepreneur Series ‘Think & Thrive’ is Sunmarke’s very own Speaker Series linking innovators and business leaders in the region with savvy students. A student moderated event, ‘Think & Thrive’ allows them to interact with guests in a unique, studio-style setting. STEAM & Design Thinking - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai STEAM & Design Thinking Signature Programmes > STEAM & Design Thinking STEAM & Design Thinking Programme Future-Ready Learning in Our SPACE-X Innovation Lab Programme Overview At Sunmarke School, the STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics) Signature Programme transforms students into inventors, engineers, designers, and problem-solvers through immersive, real-world learning. Anchored in our state-of-the-art SPACE-X Innovation and Design Thinking Lab, the programme encourages experimentation, collaboration, and creativity from EYFS to Year 11. Environment & Sustainability - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Environment & Sustainability Signature Programmes > Environment & Sustainability Environment & Sustainability Programme Nurturing Tomorrow's Environmental Changemakers Through Forest School Programme Overview Preparing Global Environmental Leaders With climate change at the forefront of global challenges, Sunmarke’s Environment & Sustainability Programme nurtures a deep connection with nature while developing scientific knowledge, eco-leadership, and sustainability values. Our immersive outdoor learning environments — including the Forest School, Zen Garden, Vegetable Garden, and Hydroponic Farming Lab — make sustainability an everyday experience. Who It’s For All students from EYFS to Year 13. The programme is cross-disciplinary and fully integrated into academic and co-curricular learning. Learning Journey EYFS: Sensory play, simple conservation habits, nature appreciation Primary: Ecosystem studies, organic gardening, biodegradable product design Secondary: Environmental research, global climate advocacy, sustainability leadership Natural Learning Environments Forest Garden: Guided biodiversity exploration Vegetable Garden: Organic farming and seasonal harvesting Zen Garden: Mindfulness and reflection in nature Hydroponic Lab: Soil-free, water-conserving agriculture using high-tech systems Signature Programme Elements Climate-focused STEM projects and eco-entrepreneurship Desert, beach, and neighbourhood clean-up drives Biodiversity and conservation field studies Student-led petitions and environmental campaigns Integration of UN Sustainable Development Goals TASS ( The Alliance for Sustainable Schools) – empowering our students to lead sustainable change through global collaboration and impactful green initiatives. Wellbeing Through Nature Stress reduction, focus, creativity, and resilience through outdoor learning Character strengths like empathy, perseverance, and responsibility nurtured in real-world contexts Curriculum Integration Science: Ecology, conservation biology, climate systems Technology: Environmental monitoring, VR tools, climate modelling Engineering: Renewable energy, sustainable design Math: Statistical analysis and modelling of environmental data Languages: Cultural approaches to conservation (Mandarin, Hindi, French) Facilities & Resources Hydroponic stations, composting units, environmental sensors Outdoor classrooms and natural laboratories Community garden and student-led sustainability zones such as Forest School and Zen Garden. Pathways & Progression GCSE, A-Level, BTEC and IB Environmental Systems & Societies Career preparation in sustainability, conservation, and environmental policy Strong university placement record in environmental and science fields Next Steps Join a Forest School session, explore the Hydroponic Lab, or attend our student-led Sustainability Showcase to witness the programme in action. University & Career Readiness Programme - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai University & Career Readiness Programme Signature Programmes > University & Career Readiness Programme University & Career Readiness Programme Helping Students Build Futures That Matter Programme Overview This comprehensive programme supports students from Year 7 to Year 13 in identifying their passions, building their personal brand, and preparing for competitive university and career pathways. Through mentoring, internships, student-led media, and global university engagement, students build real-world readiness with purpose and clarity. Who It’s For All students in Secondary School (Y7–13). Fully integrated across academic and co-curricular life. Programme Highlights AI-powered aptitude diagnostics from Year 7 Tailored pathways in Medicine, Creative Arts, Business, Engineering, and Social Sciences 1:1 counselling from Year 9 onwards Personal brand clinics, LinkedIn building, and public speaking workshops Fortes Buzz Media Hub: student-run newspaper and podcast platform Portfolio Days and University Fairs (100+ top universities annually) Personal Branding & Media “My Personal Statement” storytelling framework Podcast production and student journalism Branding workshops and admissions essay clinics Sunmarke Synergy 100+ internship placements in Dubai, Europe, and Asia Parent Partner Network for internships and mentoring Visionaries Internship Portfolio with structured work placements Think and Thrive Think & Thrive is Sunmarke’s very own Speaker Series linking innovators, artists, sports personalities, and business leaders in the region with savvy students. A student moderated event, ‘Think & Thrive’ allows them to interact with guests in a unique, studio-style setting and is an initiative that ensures our Secondary students receive the opportunity to connect with industry leaders to help them make better career choices. Top CEO’s, business leaders, sports personalities, artists and entrepreneurs share stage with our student moderator to share life experiences with them. Family & Community Involvement Futures Family Conferences to co-plan student goals Live sessions on scholarships, admissions, and career strategy Outcomes Every graduate leaves with a personal brand portfolio and professional experience Top placements at University College London, University of Durham, Imperial College London, Carnegie Mellon, University of Groningen, Georgia Tech, UCLA, University of Toronto, University of Waterloo, University of Birmingham, University of Bristol, Eindhoven University of Technology, University of Exeter, University of St. Andrews, and the University of Melbourne , amongst others. Click here to explore more universities our students have progressed to. Clarity of purpose and career direction for life beyond school Next Steps Book a counselling session, apply for an internship, or contribute to the Buzz Podcast to kickstart your journey. Positive Education - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Positive Education Signature Programmes > Positive Education Positive Education Where Amazing Happens: Nurturing Hearts, Minds & Character for Life Programme Overview A Global Paradigm Shift in Education Sunmarke School is internationally recognised as a leader in Positive Education (PosEd), combining the science of Positive Psychology with world-class pedagogy. Our whole-school approach fosters wellbeing, character development, and academic excellence through intentional practices embedded across every phase. Who is it for ? Our POSED (Positive Education) programme is designed for all students, from EYFS through to Year 13, nurturing wellbeing, resilience, and character development at every stage of their learning journey. The Science Behind PosEd Based on evidence from the University of Pennsylvania and Geelong Grammar School, PosEd improves academic achievement, social-emotional skills, and mental health. Students flourish by developing emotional intelligence, resilience, optimism, and a strong sense of purpose. Learning Journey EYFS: Play-based social learning, emotional literacy, friendships Primary: Growth mindset, kindness curriculum, resilience games Secondary: Mental health education, leadership through values, strengths-based career planning What Students Experience Daily character strengths integration across all subjects Signature strengths-based learning across six virtues (e.g., wisdom, courage, humanity) Classroom mindfulness, reflective journaling, peer recognition Termly themes and classroom initiatives aligned with PosEd values Support Ecosystem Counsellors, Heads of Year, and form tutors trained in PosEd practices Parent community workshops: Wellness Wednesday, Digital Age Parenting, Nutrition & Wellbeing Drop-in wellbeing support and crisis intervention protocols Recognition & Impact KHDA rated ‘Very Good’ and BSO awarded an ‘Outstanding’ rating for wellbeing.’ Top 5 academic performance in Dubai driven by PosEd integration University placements and corporate internships linked to confidence, resilience, and purpose Facilities & Tools Quiet spaces for mindfulness and reflection Digital wellbeing platforms Character strengths diagnostic tools Peer mentorship and PosEd ambassador programme Next Steps Join one of our Positive Education (PosEd) workshops, attend a parent information session, or connect with our dedicated wellbeing team to learn how we nurture student wellbeing, resilience, and character development across all year groups. Global Language Academy - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Global Language Academy Signature Programmes > Global Language Academy Global Language Academy Connecting Language, Culture & Global Citizenship Programme Overview Sunmarke’s Global Languages Programme immerses students in two of the world’s most influential languages — Hindi and Mandarin — helping them become confident communicators and empathetic global citizens. Through storytelling, culture, cuisine, arts, and literature, students don’t just learn a language — they experience a civilisation. Who It’s For All students from EYFS to Year 13 — including beginners, heritage learners, and those learning as a foreign language. What Students Experience Hindi Programme: Offered from EYFS to Year 6, focusing on festivals, food, theatre, and personal identity Mandarin Programme: Offered from EYFS to Year 9, aligned with the Youth Chinese Test (YCT) and GCSE Integration of language with culture through activities like calligraphy, traditional dance, tai chi, cooking, and music Celebration assemblies, festivals, and school-wide events for Diwali, Holi, and Chinese New Year Learning Journey EYFS: Gentle immersion through storytelling, songs, and sensory activities Primary: Games, roleplay, cultural crafts, cooking, oral fluency Secondary: Grammar, writing, debating, cross-cultural discussions, YCT and GCSE prep Cultural Fluency Development Guest workshops, performances, and cultural exchanges Integrated storytelling and global themes across languages and literature Personal identity development and intercultural understanding Facilities & Learning Tools Immersive classrooms with cultural artefacts Professional audio-visual tools and gamified apps Culturally responsive library collections in Hindi and Mandarin Curriculum and Assessment Aligned with international language learning pathways Integrated into core curriculum, supported by enrichment and ECAs Assessment includes formative feedback, portfolios , and recognised external qualifications Links to IB and A-Level language options , international university language entry requirements Next Steps Speak to the Head of Global, visit a class, attend a cultural showcase, or explore our Languages programme to begin your child’s multilingual journey. Financial Literacy Programme - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Financial Literacy Programme Signature Programmes > Financial Literacy Programme Financial Literacy Programme Empowering Smart Thinkers, Savvy Spenders, and Ethical Investors for Life Programme Overview Rethinking Money, Purpose & Power Sunmarke’s Financial Literacy Programme builds money-smart who understand how to earn, manage, grow, and give responsibly. Combining practical learning with global best practices, the programme encourages ethical investment, personal finance skills, and entrepreneurial thinking through hands-on experience and real-world simulations. Who is it for? Our Financial Literacy Programme is designed for all students — from EYFS through to Year 13 — equipping them with essential money management skills from an early age. Learning Journey EYFS: Needs vs wants, saving, goal-setting, money role-play Primary: Micro-enterprises, budgeting for STEAM projects, school markets Secondary: Budgeting, taxes, investment simulations, crypto literacy Flagship Feature (Years 10–13) Wharton Global High School Investment Competition Select students are invited to represent Sunmarke in this prestigious competition from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania . • Compete globally with students from 65+ countries • Work in teams to manage a $100,000 virtual portfolio • Develop deep skills in financial analysis, strategic thinking, and investor reporting • Benefit from mentorship, leadership coaching , and real-world financial expertise Signature Experiences Wharton Global High School Investment Competition Stock market and crypto simulation games Guest talks by ethical investors and bankers Field trips to financial institutions Global microloan projects in collaboration with nonprofits Skills Developed Financial numeracy and budgeting Entrepreneurial strategy and innovation Ethical reasoning and decision-making Self-discipline and long-term goal planning Curriculum Integration Maths: Ratios, interest, modelling Business & Economics: Market dynamics, investment planning Humanities: Ethical wealth, socio-economic systems STEAM: Product Innovation, Pricing and sustainability accounting Recognition & Pathways Competitive edge for degrees in finance, business, economics, and entrepreneurship Preparation for GCSE, A-Level, IB Economics and Business Financial Literacy Journals and Portfolios for university applications Next Steps Attend the Sunmarke Finance Fair, speak with our Business & Economics faculty, or learn about alumni who’ve pursued global business and finance careers. Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Signature Programmes > Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Accelerated Business Leadership for the Next Generation of Entrepreneurs, Economists & Changemakers Programme Overview From the Classroom to the Boardroom: A First Glimpse at the MBA Mindset The Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme at Sunmarke offers ambitious students in Years 10 to 13 a transformative opportunity to explore the world of business, strategy, leadership, and innovation. Designed in collaboration with Sunmarke’s business faculty and guest lecturers from the University of Birmingham, this selective programme mirrors the academic and practical rigour of a traditional MBA — adapted for high school learners. Who It’s For Business and Economics students (Y10–13) Future leaders in entrepreneurship, consulting, finance, marketing, or social impact Motivated students seeking university-level academic challenge and real-world relevance Programme Highlights Weekly MBA-style modules delivered during school hours Led by Sunmarke business faculty and University of Birmingham lecturers Real-world business challenges, simulations, and professional mentoring Capstone business project presented to external academic and industry leaders Key Topics Covered Strategic Thinking & Organisational Leadership Entrepreneurship & Venture Creation Corporate Finance & Investment Decision-Making Marketing Strategy & Brand Development ESG & Business Ethics Global Economics & Market Forces Business Analytics & Data-Driven Decision Making Operations & Supply Chain Management Capstone Business Project Each student or team creates a business plan and formal pitch based on a real-world challenge. They develop: Business model and financial forecasting Market research and investor strategies Public speaking and persuasive presentation skills A final pitch judged by entrepreneurs, university professors, and investors Skills & Student Outcomes Analytical and financial reasoning Team leadership and stakeholder management Strategic problem-solving and innovation Strong university and internship readiness Recognition & Pathways Mini-MBA Certificate of Completion Showcase at Sunmarke’s Enterprise Exhibition Shortlisted projects may be submitted for interschool and global business competitions Next Steps Apply through the Business Department. Attend the Mini-MBA Info Evening or explore past capstone projects to get inspired. Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Signature Programmes > Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Empowering Student Voice Through Creative Expression Programme Overview This dynamic programme blends drama, journalism, podcasting, public speaking, film, and media production into a powerful creative journey. Across all phases, students explore how storytelling, movement, voice, and technology can influence, inspire, and ignite change — all while developing confidence and stage presence in Sunmarke’s world-class performing arts facilities. Who It’s For All students from EYFS to Year 13, with progressive exposure to theatre, communication, media production, and digital storytelling. Learning Journey EYFS & Years 1–2: Storytelling corners, mini-stages, puppetry, ‘Show and Tell’ Years 3–6: Primary Drama, Junior Journalism Club, podcasting, performance poetry Years 7–9: Music and Drama, ensemble performance, student newspaper writing, public speaking Years 10–11: IGCSE/BTEC Creative Media, Sunmarke Newsroom, school podcast and radio productions. Years 12–13: IB Film / A-Level Media, extended podcasts, leadership communication projects Signature Techniques & Tools Voice & Persuasion: TED Talks, MUN, debates Audio & Broadcast: In-house podcasting studio, sound editing tools Written Communication: Blogs, opinion pieces, editorial writing Visual Storytelling: Film production, storyboard workshops, cinematography Stage & Screen: Annual theatre productions, skits, monologues, musical showcases Signature Experiences The Buzz Reporters editorial team Fortes Film Lab with coaching and equipment Speech Festivals and performance showcases Local internships with media houses and radio stations University masterclasses and industry panels Facilities 400-seat Sunmarke Auditorium Podcasting studio and media production suite Film editing lab and digital newsroom setup Black box Music lab Pathways & Progression Media, Journalism, Communications, Performing Arts university pathways Careers in media strategy, podcasting, digital content, stage direction, or public relations Assessment Models Coursework: Video projects, written publications, podcasts and creative portfolios Performance Review: Monologue and group presentation assessments Feedback Cycles: Peer reviews, professional critique panels, and self-evaluation Real-World Metrics: Podcast streams, article views, and theatre audience engagement Next Steps Join a student production, apply to the Buzz Reporters, or pitch your idea for a podcast or short film to the Media & Performing Arts team. Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students | Sunmarke School Scholarships Admissions > Scholarships Sunmarke Fellows Our Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students The Fortes Scholarship Programme is a recognition of ability and application of students who have not only demonstrated a high level of academic, sporting or artistic skills, but have also displayed motivation and drive to succeed. Inspiring Purpose. Driving Passion. With exceptional teachers and subject specialists, we provide a dynamic and innovative curriculum that is designed to meet and inspire the talents and interests of our Gifted & Talented scholars. Our approach helps students stretch their abilities, build confidence, and pursue advanced pathways that match their strengths. We encourage curiosity, creativity, and independence so each scholar can excel in areas where they show remarkable potential. FAQs What are the available Scholarship Categories? Currently, our Fortes Schools are offering the following scholarship categories: Academic Scholarship Academic geniuses who strive for a place at the world’s top universities. Sports Scholarship Outstanding performers on the field who can bring laurels to their school and nation Music Scholarship Passionate performers who can touch the hearts of millions with their vocals or skills on a musical instrument. Art Scholarship Artists who can colour the canvas with their imagination and expression. Student of the Future Scholarship Visionary thinkers who we can mould for the jobs of the future. The Founder’s Scholarship We are looking for the gifted and talented who we can support in their journey to become legends. What are the Scholarship Criteria? Do keep the following documents ready before you fill in the application form: Criteria for All Scholarships 2 references 3 Essay questions Personal statement (< 500 words) Scholarship question (<500 words) Leadership essay (< 500 words) Video presentation (< 7 mins) Video must have: Introduction to yourself Why do you deserve this scholarship? Additional Criteria for Academic Scholarships CAT score = or > 133 For students applying for Year 10, 11 and 13: GL Data in Y9 and Y10 to be Stanine 8 or above in English, Maths and or Science For students applying for Year 12: 10 or more GCSEs taken with scores of 7-9’s or A to A* Additional Criteria for Sports Scholarships The student should have achieved national/international sporting representative honours in at least 1 of the following sports – Football, Swimming, Basketball, Cricket, Netball, Golf, Rugby, Volleyball, Athletics, Tennis. Valid for the last 2 years Or any notable awards received. Additional Criteria for Music Scholarships The student should have achieved Grade 6 in at least 1 musical instrument or voice through Trinity or ABRSM Valid in the last 3 years Evidence of solo live performance outside of school Additional Criteria for Art Scholarships Portfolio and evidence of exhibition Additional Criteria for Student of the Future Scholarships Portfolio and evidence of having a future skill. The skill can be related to Coding, Crypto, Social Work, Robotics, etc. Certifications/endorsements required. What do we expect from a scholar? We would like to set expectations with the scholar on performance during the scholarship year. This is essential for the Scholarship Performance Review. For All Scholars: Consistent commitment to growth and development Active participation in internal and external activities. For example, the World Scholar’s Cup, MUN, TEDx, Duke of Edinburgh, Internships, social work among others To act as a brand ambassador of the school across all platforms. For example, social media, PR, videos, etc. For Academic Scholars: To be in the 95 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 7-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Sports Scholars: Maintain national/international representation in the sport or participate and represent the school in a notable tournament To be in the 70 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 6-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Music Scholars: Participation in school showcases such as concerts, musicals, etc. Participation in the school bands, choirs and ensembles To be in the 75 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 6-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Arts Scholars: A* or 8-9 in GCSE Art and Design, Ceramics or Textiles To be in the 75 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) Maintain an exceptional portfolio and evidence of external exhibition For Student of the Future Scholars: Maintain an exceptional portfolio of future skill To be in the 80 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 7-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) What will we offer? Our Fortes School will create an environment conducive for a scholar’s growth. A Fortes School will : For All Scholars Ensure that the student receives guidance to develop a strong character and become a well-rounded individual Ensure the student has adequate support to perform academically Ensure opportunities to explore leadership positions within the Student Leadership Team Ensure opportunities to participate in activities outside the curriculum For Academic Scholars Provide an environment that encourages the student to achieve the highest academic standards For Sports Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Music Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Art Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Student of the Future Scholar Provide an environment that encourages the student to achieve the highest academic standards Ensure that the student receives opportunities to meet mentors in the field of interest Students from which Year Groups are eligible for a Scholarship? Students in Year 9 (British Curriculum) or equivalent in other curriculums applying for Year 10 and upwards are eligible for scholarships. Where to apply for the Fortes Scholarship Programme? New Student to the School After filling out the Admission Application Form Complete the admission application form to Fortes School. At the end of the application form, select the button to ‘Apply for Scholarship’. You will be directed to the Scholarship Form. Request for the Scholarship Form You can also request for the Scholarship Form from the admissions team, who will send you a unique link. However, the Application Form is mandatory in this case as well. Sunmarke Student You may apply for the scholarship via the VLE where you will find a link to the Scholarship Application Form. Click here to log in. What to expect after submitting the Scholarship Form? Application Review : Your application will be reviewed by our Academic Panel Audition : Should you get shortlisted, you will be invited to the school for an audition Interview : If you make it as a finalist, you will be invited for an interview with the Principal of the school Finally, your application will be assessed and successful applicants could receive a partial scholarship on the annual fees. Is the Scholarship only for the Year of admission or all subsequent years? A scholarship is renewable yearly between Year 10 and Year 13. The student’s scholarship continuation is subject to a termly Panel Review that showcases his/her participation, growth and development .

FAQs - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai FAQs Admissions > FAQs Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) All You Want To Know About The School And Its Facilities We have compiled a list of questions that parents are most likely to ask us in the early stages of the application process – we hope you find it useful. Should you have any other questions, please get in touch with our Family Happiness Team and we will be happy to help. How do I enrol my child? Enrolment for 2024-25 – New families 1) Can I come in for a school tour with my family? Yes, we would be delighted to welcome you and your family for a school tour. It’s a great opportunity to experience the atmosphere and gain insight into our school. 2) KHDA Parent School Contract Please note that: Students can only attend school if they are registered in the KHDA School System, and parents have signed the Parent-School Contract. The school will register the student once all the relevant documents have been uploaded by the parents. This contract needs to be digitally signed only once – by parents of students who are new to the school. The contract is usually sent via sms on their local mobile phones registered with the school. 3) Documents for Registering at Sunmarke School If you are a new family, joining the school, please ensure that all pending documentation for your child is submitted to the Admissions department at Sunmarke School. Documents required to complete the registration process: Latest School Reports School reference letter, if a report is not available Attested Transfer Certificate 1 Passport Size Coloured Photo (Student and both Parents) Student Passport Copy Sponsoring Parents Passport Copy Student’s Emirates ID Card (back & Front) Sponsoring Parent Emirates ID card (back & Front) Vaccination & Immunisation Record Copy 4) Age Cut-Off Dates New students must be enrolled in their respective age groups as per the ministerial decree (820) of 2014. The cut-off date is 31 st August without exception. The table below shows the age/year-group information of students aged 3 to 6. Sunmarke School is required to comply with the age/year-group criteria and the cut-off date as per the ministerial decree. Year FS1 FS2 Year 1 Year 2 Age by 31 st August 3 4 5 6 This is a federal law and we are not able to consider any exemption requests. What are the KHDA guidelines for Admissions and Transfers? Click here to read Guidelines for Admissions and Transfers by KHDA. How do I book Assessments? Admissions are open year-round, with prorated fees available. We are booking assessments for FS1, FS2, Year 1 to 10, and Year 12. For students currently overseas, we can offer online assessments. Please contact the Sunmarke Admissions Office to confirm your child’s assessment date. Can my child be assessed before arriving in Dubai? Online Assessment Procedure: The assessment will take place at home under exam conditions via MS Teams. For Year 6 and below, we recommend adult supervision throughout. Ensure your child has a quiet, distraction-free workspace and the necessary equipment: a computer with internet, video, and audio capabilities. All other electronic devices should be switched off. You will receive an email with the meeting link. Please check access ahead of time and join at the scheduled time. Assistance is only allowed for setting up the meeting and login. Any interference during the assessment will invalidate the results. Assessment Checklist: Quiet, well-ventilated workspace. Computer with internet, video, and audio. All distractions (TV, phones, etc.) turned off. Microsoft Teams ready to join the meeting. What are the tuition fees for FS1- Year 13 (2025-26)? Tuition Fees Click here to view the Tuition Fees: New Students - FS1 to Year 13 - 2025-26 What are the KHDA document fees? Tariff for the following KHDA services as stipulated by KHDA: Request for student Education Continuation Certificate for visa renewal (AED 120) Request for student leaving form for the students who are leaving Dubai (AED 120) Request for student transfer between private schools (within the stipulated time frame)-Student transfer (AED 120) Can my child with special education needs attend Sunmarke school? At Sunmarke, we exercise a positive and inclusive admissions policy. Candidates will each be given due consideration on a case-by-case basis, and we will take into account the capacity of the premises, staff and curriculum pathways to effectively meet the needs of the individual. Our Achievement Centre offers a broad range of additional support for students with SEND, including targeted support in maths, literacy, and SEMH (social and emotional mental health). We currently offer an alternative curriculum pathway for Key Stages 3 and 4. 1. Is it approved by the Ministry of Education? It is a mainstream curriculum, delivered by specialist teachers and LSAs. There is no need for permission for this pathway as it falls under our current education licence. 2. What are the timings if my son is enroled in this program? The timings are that of the normal school day, unless the student has additional needs or commitments outside of school that need to be met. As a KHDA accredited Rahhal provider, we can review timings to meet the student’s needs. 3. What is the cost for LSA? Costs are an estimate range until all students are enroled. 4. What would be mentioned in the invoice for this program? Is it “Tuition fee”? School fees are billed as normal. Parents will then have to sign a KHDA Individual Service Agreement for the LSP cost. This will then be a separate invoice. 5. How will I enrol my child? Our SENCO will assess the student before we can accept to ensure we can meet their needs in this class. It is a pathway that supports access to the mainstream and we can’t cater for severe needs. What are the facilities you offer? What are the facilities you offer? We have state-of-the-art facilities on offer with special attention paid to athletics, the arts and the latest technological advancements. Below is an indication of the amenities provided to our students. Facilities Athletics Creative and Performing Arts Academic FIFA - 18 Sized Football Pitch 200 Meter Athletics Running Track Two Swimming Pools Tennis, Basketball, Volleyball and Netball Courts Two Expansive Multipurpose Halls Three Fine Arts Labs Dedicated Drama Studio 600 Seat Auditorium Four Music Labs TV & Radio Production Studios Nine World-Class Science Labs Five Design Technology Labs Three Libraries with Media Centres What nationalities make up the school body? Sunmarke is a truly international school with a focus on fostering diversity and nurturing talent. Sunmarke continues in Regent International ‘s tradition with regards to enrolment with 90+ nationalities represented with the largest percentage hailing from the U.K. What are the school timings? Year Group Timings Foundation Stage 1 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am – 1:15 pm Friday 7:40 am – 11:30 am Foundation Stage 2 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am – 1:15 pm Friday 7:40 am – 11:30 am Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am – 3:30 pm Friday 7:40 am – 11:45 am Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am – 3:30 pm Friday 7:40 am – 11:45 am For detailed EYFS timings click here For detailed Primary timings click here For detailed Secondary & Sixth Form timings click here What school transport is offered? What school transport is offered? Sunmarke uses an independent third party bus operator “My Bus Transport Services LLC” to make the school run as easy as possible. “My Bus” operates an air-conditioned and efficient transport service from various parts of Dubai to the school. Parents may avail of this service at their own discretion and cost. My Bus Transport Services manages the school transport operations. The details of services, route and fees, are now available from the Transport office. You can also find the details online, please click here . For more information on our routes and the health & safety protocols for our buses, please click here . What is the pickup/drop off timings? School Transport Timings Bus start times remain the same. For drop-off, buses will leave from the school at the following times Year Group Timings EYFS Monday to Thursday 1:30 pm onwards Friday 12:10 pm onwards Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 3:40 pm onwards Friday 12.10 pm onwards Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 3:40 pm onwards Friday 12:10 pm onwards Further communication related to pick-up and drop-off schedules will be shared by the transportation department upon successful registration and payment. How do I order food for my child? 1. How do I book the service? Booking can only be done for EYFS and Primary students. Secondary students can go directly to the canteen to select their food and make payment. EYFS and Primary parents need to pre-book their order in advance via the link provided http://form.jotform.com/Mastercook/Sunmarke-stripe and lunch will be delivered in their class. 2. What is the price for lunch? Lunch is priced at AED24.25 this includes the main lunch and a dessert. 3. What is the menu like? Please click TERM MENU to see current available menu. Alternatively, secondary students can check out our GRAB AND GO menu. 4. Do you offer special meal plans? As a nut-free school, all meals are prepared using nut-free products. We also offer bespoke menus for students with special dietary needs, including gluten-free, dairy-free, etc. For this request, please contact coordinator@mastercook.ae for a specialised price and to discuss options. 5. Does your menu contain allergen information? As per Dubai Municipality guidelines, we follow their standard of menu labels that include the ingredients, allergens, and calorie content. The menu also has a specialised coding that identifies the contents of the meal, allowing our students to check if it contains something they are allergic to. Please communicate this to your child if they are in Secondary school. With Lactose With Egg With gluten Seafood With Soy Vegetarian 6. Can my child buy food at the Grab & Go counter? This option caters only to our Secondary school students and staff. The Grab & Go section of the dining services is exactly what it is – you grab the food, make the payment, and go on with your daily activity. We always ensure that there is a menu suitable for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. 7. What are the canteen timings? The canteen is open from 7am to 3.30 pm Monday to Thursday and 7am to 12:00 noon on Friday. Please note that only the Grab and Go section of the canteen is open on Friday. 8. Is breakfast available in the canteen? A healthy breakfast, via the Grab and Go section, is available daily from 7am. Secondary school students can only use the canteen at break time and lunchtime. 9. What time are the dining services available and when is lunch delivered to EYFS and Primary students? The lunch period for various year groups is listed as per the below timetable. For EYFS and Primary students, lunch will be delivered to their classroom prior to their scheduled lunch break. All the delivered lunches will have the names clearly labelled on them so that teachers can easily identify and distribute them to the children during lunchtime. How do I enrol my child? Enrolment for 2025-26 – New families 1) Can I come in for a school tour with my family? We are now able to conduct school tours for prospective students and their parents. 2) KHDA Parent School Contract To prepare for enrolment into the new academic year 2025-26, please note that: Students can only attend school in the new academic year if they are registered in the KHDA School System and parents have signed the Parent-School Contract. Please download the Dubai Now App which will enable you to sign the Parent/School Contract online. This only needs to be signed by parents of students who are new to the school. 3) Documents for Registering at Sunmarke School If you are a new family, joining the school for 2025-26, please ensure that all pending documentation for your child is submitted to the Admissions department at Sunmarke School. Documents that should be submitted to the school are: Letter of current enrolment at school (Year 2 Up) Transfer Certificate (Attested by UAE Embassy) School reference letter (Year 2 Up) School Reports – 2024-25 (Year 2 Up) 1 Passport Size Coloured Photo ( Student and both Parents) Student Passport Copy Student UAE Visa Copy Sponsoring Parents Passport and UAE Visa Copy Birth Certificate (in English or Arabic) Student’s Emirates ID Card (back & Front) Sponsoring Parent Emirates ID card (back & Front) Vaccination & Immunisation Record Copy DHA Medical & Immunisation Consent form 4) Age Cut-Off Dates New students must be enroled in their respective age groups as per the ministerial decree (820) of 2014. The cut-off date is 31 st August without exception. The table below shows the age/year-group information of students aged 3 to 6. Sunmarke School is required to comply with the age/year-group criteria and the cut-off date as per the ministerial decree. Year FS1 FS2 Year 1 Year 2 Age by 31 st August 3 4 5 6 This is a federal law and we are not able to consider any exemption requests. What are the KHDA guidelines for Admissions and Transfers? Click here to read Guidelines for Admissions and Transfers by KHDA. What are the age requirements for AY 2024-25? 1. What are the changes to the age requirements for entry to Sunmarke School? Age requirements will change for new students enroled into FS1, according to the UAE Ministry of Education Resolution no (24). Children enroling into FS1, starting in September, must be three years old on or before the 31st of August. Children enroling into FS2, starting in September, must be four years old on or before the 31st of August. Similarly, children enroling into Year 1, starting school in September, must be five years old on or before the 31st of August. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. This includes students who enrol for the final term of the 2023/24 academic year. Schools that start the academic year in September, in line with MOE Resolution no (24). Year Group Age requirement Foundation Stage 1 3 years old by August 31st Foundation Stage 2 4 years old by August 31st Year 1 5 years old by August 31 Year 2 6 years old by August 31 2. When did this change come into effect? This change was applicable from the start of the 2021/22 academic year in September 2021. 3. Why was this change made? This decision was made to bring more consistency to the cut-off dates used by schools in the UAE with those used by schools abroad. For example, UK schools in the UAE will now have the same cut-off date as schools in the UK, and international British schools. 4.Who will this change impact? This change will impact children up to six years old who are enrolling in school for the first time. 5. Will the new cut-off date apply to all year groups? It will apply to new students enrolling in FS1, FS2, Year 1 and Year 2 in all schools in the UAE, as stipulated in the MOE resolution. 6. My child was born in October and is now in FS1 – I want to enrol him in another school for FS2. Can I do this or does he have to repeat a year? Because your child is already enroled in school, the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution do not apply. He does not have to repeat the year. 7. My son was enroled in FS1 this year but I withdrew his enrolment due to COVID-19. He’ll be 3 years old in September. Can I still enrol him in FS2 next year? Your child must have formally finished the previous academic year in order to enrol in the next one. Since he does not meet the age requirement for FS2 for next academic year, he must enrol in FS1. According to the MOE resolution, he can enrol in FS2 next academic year only if he completes FS1 this academic year. 8. My daughter will be 4 years old in December. If I enrol her in FS2 for the last term of this year – before the changes come into effect – will she be able to start Year 1 next year? Yes. The new age requirements will apply for new students from the start of the next academic year only. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. 9. I’ve already registered and paid the deposit for my daughter to start school in FS2 in September. She will be four years old in November. Is she affected by this? According to the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution, your daughter will not be able to start in FS2 in September. Alternatively, we would be happy to transfer your child’s application to their age-appropriate year group (FS1) and register your child for this year group instead. Parents whose children are affected by the new cut-off dates and who have already paid deposits for their children’s enrolment are entitled to a refund if they wish. 10. My child was born one day after the cut-off date. Is there some leeway given? No exceptions to the cut-off dates will be given under any circumstances How do I book Assessments for entry 2025-26 AY? Admissions are now open for applications for 2025-26 AY* entry. The 2025-2026 Assessment Diary is Open – We are now booking assessments for year groups FS1 & FS2, Year 1 to 10 and Year 12. Please contact the Sunmarke Admissions Office to confirm your child’s assessment date. For students currently overseas: For students in current Year 6 and above we can offer Assessment at the current school attended. Please contact us to find out more. Students transferring from UK schools in all years, please contact us directly for more details. Can my child be assessed before arriving into Dubai? For Students entering Year 7 and above, assessment can be offered at the current school attended if that school is willing to administer the test under examination conditions. The assessment will be the same as that taken by our local students with the addition of a Skype interview. You will need to provide registration, a letter of enrolment, the latest school report, and a recommendation form by the date of assessment. For students transferring from UK schools please contact admissions directly to discuss your application. What are the tuition fees for FS1- Year 13 (2025-26)? Tuition Fees Click here to view the Tuition Fees: New Students – FS1 to Year 13 – 2025-26 What are the KHDA document fees? Tariff for the following KHDA services as stipulated by KHDA: Request for student Education Continuation Certificate for visa renewal (AED 120) Request for student leaving form for the students who are leaving Dubai (AED 120) Request for student transfer between private schools (within the stipulated time frame)-Student transfer (AED 120) Can my child with special education needs attend Sunmarke school? At Sunmarke, we exercise a positive and inclusive admissions policy. Candidates will each be given due consideration on a case-by-case basis, and we will take into account the capacity of the premises, staff and curriculum pathways to effectively meet the needs of the individual. Our Achievement Centre offers a broad range of additional support for students with SEND, including targeted support in language, maths, literacy, and functional independence. We are currently working to develop our range of alternative curriculum pathways for Key Stages 2, 3, and 4 so that, in time, we can offer an appropriate pathway for every learner. What is Year 7 and Year 8 Life skills Pathway? 1. Is it approved by the Ministry of Education? It is a mainstream curriculum, supplemented by ASDAN modules. As it is a supplemented curriculum which focuses on reduced teachers, as per KHDA, there is no need for permission for this pathway as it falls under our current education licence. 2. What are the timings if my son is enroled in this program? The timings are that of the normal school day, unless the student has additional needs or commitments outside of school that need to be met. As a KHDA accredited Rahhal provider, we can review timings to meet the student’s needs. 3. What is the cost for LSA? Costs are an estimate range until all students are enroled. 4. What would be mentioned in the invoice for this program? Is it “Tuition fee”? School fees are billed as normal. Parents will then have to sign a KHDA Individual Service Agreement for the LSA cost. This will then be a separate invoice. 5 How will I enrol my child? Our SENCO will assess the student before we can accept to ensure we can meet their needs in this class. It is a pathway that supports access to the mainstream and we can’t cater for severe needs. For more information on the pathway, please click here What is the Assessment, Registration, and Re-enrolment fees for Regent International School students transferring to Sunmarke School? What is the Assessment, Registration, and Re-enrolment fees for Regent International School students transferring to Sunmarke School? Students transferring to Sunmarke School from Regent International School, will not be required to pay additional Assessment or Registration fees. Transferring students are only required to complete the RIS Re-Enrollment Form and pay the 5 % re-enrolment fee by the start of the third term each year to secure their seat. What are the tuition fees and discounts for Regent International School transfers to Sunmarke school for FS1-Year 13 (2025-26)? Fee Structure – Transferring students from Regent International School to Sunmarke School Application Fee Dhs.525/- – Not chargeable Re-enrollment Fee (Existing Students) 5% of Tuition Fee – Non-refundable, adjusted against the 1st Term’s Tuition Fee, 1st day of Term3 Transferring RIS Students Phase Tuition Fees Year Group Discounted Tuition Fees for students transferring from Year 6 at Regent Foundation 1 46,700 Foundation 2 51,900 Year 1 58,548 Year 2 58,548 Year 3 59,619 Year 4 59,619 Year 5 59,619 Year 6 59,619 Year 7 67,290 Year 8 67,290 Year 9 67,290 Year 10 69,397 Year 11 69,397 Year 12 70,276 Year 13 70,276 Additional Benefits: Sibling Discounts: 1st Sibling 5%, 2nd Sibling 10%, 3rd Sibling 10%, 4th Sibling 10%. The sibling discount scheme is available to those siblings from the same family who enrol at the school for one full academic year. The sibling discount is applicable to the 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th child from the same family. The amount of the discount is calculated off the actual Tuition Fee paid of the child who pays the lowest tuition fee amongst the siblings enrolled at the school. The maximum discount per family is equal to 35% of the lowest sibling’s tuition fee. What is the Sunmarke School and Regent International School returning students -Founders Fee entitlement? If a Regent International School or Sunmarke School student leaves the school but returns to the School before the end of one (1) academic term, they will keep their entitlement to the Regent International School Transfers to Sunmarke School Tuition Fee Structure. If more than one Term passes, then the student will be considered a New Student and will be required to pay the New Students Fee Structure as applicable to their group of re-entry. School Uniform - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai School Uniform For Parents > School Uniform School Uniform Instilling A Sense Of Pride And Uniformity Among Students Wearing a school uniform creates a sense of unity and pride in the school community, with students understanding that they are part of one big family. Hence it has been made mandatory for all pupils to wear the prescribed school uniform. The uniform and other accessories can be purchased from the Sunmarke Uniform Store located within the school premises. Parents can also place an order through our Online Uniform Store. Here’s how: Visit our Sunmarke Online Uniform Store to select and order uniform items and/or accessories. You may pay online and have the items delivered or pick them up from the Uniform Shop at the school building. Sixth Form Uniform Policy Download Here are some other rules and dos & don’ts regarding appearance and dressing in the school: Students must be neatly dressed in ironed clothes and maintain a clean appearance. Extreme hairstyles and colours are not allowed. Students wearing trousers must wear a black belt. Parents should provide an apron for Art & Craft class. Shoulder length hair must be tied up for swimming and other practical lessons such as Art and Crafts. Colourful nail polish is not allowed. Students must wear black leather shoes and dark blue socks. For safety reasons, shoes should be flat with closed tops and laces or Velcro straps. Heels and boot-style shoes are not allowed. All items of uniform must be marked with your child’s name. Jewellery is not permitted for students with the exception of small stud earrings for girls or jewellery which is required to be worn for religious purposes. These must be either removed or covered with tape by the parent on the day of PE. Students of Key Stage 2 and above are allowed and encouraged to wear a watch to school. Uniform Shop Timings Monday to Thursday 7.30 am to 9.30 am Friday 10.30 am to 12.30 pm *Please note, these times may vary during half-term breaks. For Uniform enquiries, please contact the Uniform Shop on +971 4 423 8900
